summary.main: The logo at the Header component is currently off-center, affecting the overall visual alignment and aesthetics of the page. The issue needs to be fixed so that the logo is horizontally centered within the header across all screen sizes.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is to create a new library, Beman.RangesAndViews, which should grow incrementally. The library should include basic concepts and structs for ranges, such as range, view sentinel, etc., and utils incrementally, such as std::views::upto, std::views::to_input, and std::views::cache_last.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by creating a new repository for each view type, such as ranges_and_views.indices, ranges_and_views.to_input, and ranges_and_views.cache_last. The implementation can be found in the indices_view repository.
summary.otherNotes: This task is to create a new Beman.RangesAndViews library, which should grow incrementally. The task is to create the project and namespace within Beman, and add to it the basic concepts and structs for ranges, such as range, view sentinel, etc. The library should also include utils incrementally, such as std::views::upto, std::views::to_input, and std::views::cache_last. The implementation can be found in the indices_view repository.

issueDTO.title: [Spinner] - hardcoded aria-label attribute
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the problem**

Edit 4/11/2025:

This issue should be scoped to just updating how we're defining the default value of the aria-label on Spinner. Ideally we want the default value to be rendered in the props table, rather than rendering as though there isn't any default value currently.


Original comment:

The `Spinner` component hardcodes `aria-label` attribute when neither `aria-label` nor `aria-labelledby` is provided.

https://github.com/patternfly/patternfly-react/blob/3ba79b0c6c6e750996f6134251dc6c6bd5eeb28a/packages/react-core/src/components/Spinner/Spinner.tsx#L47

**How do you reproduce the problem?**

Mount a `Spinner` without providing an `aria-label` or `aria-labelledby`.

**Expected behavior**

A spinner without a hardcoded English value. The component should allow consumers to use it without `aria-label` or `aria-labelledby`. It might be just a complementary visual hint hidden from the a11y tree using `aria-hidden` when rendered alongside relevant text.

**Is this issue blocking you?**

Somehow. A workaround exists by setting `aria-labelledby`, but it would be preferable if, as said above, the spinner could be used as a visual hint for sighted users while being excluded from the a11y tree.

**Screenshots**

N/A

**What is your environment?**

N/A

**What is your product and what release date are you targeting?**

N/A

**Any other information?**

- The [Spinner props documentation](https://www.patternfly.org/components/spinner#spinner) does not mention a default value for `aria-label`.
- This behavior was introduced in commit 09733cb4f0fc5cd67f5df284 as part of https://github.com/patternfly/patternfly-react/pull/6730, but I was not able to find the reasoning there.
- `aria-valuetext` also has a hardcoded default value, even when it may not be applicable.

  > `aria-valuetext` is only needed when the numeric value of `aria-valuenow` is not meaningful.  
  >
  > [MDN Documentation](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Reference/Attributes/aria-valuetext)
comments:
I'd probably reconsider whether it should be hidden from the accessibility tree, even if there's other text close to the Spinner that conveys some sort of loading state. Main reason being is that the spinner will convey that the loading progress is "indeterminate", which surrounding text may or may not do. Semantically having the Spinner exposed may make more sense as well than just plain text.

At least according to MDN, either aria-label or aria-labelledby is also required on the progressbar role. That I think makes sense since just the aria-valuenow content (be it "Loading" or something similar) doesn't provide great context (what exactly is loading?).

Though I might strongly recommend against it, if `aria-hidden` is being passed to a Spinner, that should somewhat resolve the issue of having a default aria-label applied. While the aria-label will still be there, the Spinner won't be in the a11y tree.

I do think we can tweak the Spinner code so that the default value of aria-label is rendered in the props table, though.

First of all, **thanks a lot** for your detailed and insightful answer.

> I'd probably reconsider whether it should be hidden from the accessibility tree, 

Sure, after reading your explanations I will not hide it.

> even if there's other text close to the Spinner that conveys some sort of loading state. Main reason being is that the spinner will convey that the loading progress is "indeterminate", which surrounding text may or may not do. Semantically having the Spinner exposed may make more sense as well than just plain text.
> 
> At least according to MDN, either aria-label or aria-labelledby is also required on the progressbar role. 

Arg! My fault! I completely overlooked the `progressbar` role that the Spinner SVG is using! That’s why I wasn’t fully understanding the decision of going for these default values.

Regarding having both the `aria-label` and the static text, I thought it might be redundant and possibly annoying for screen reader users, especially if both contain the same message. In any case, now that I have a better understanding, I’ll rework my use of the Spinner to include only one descriptive text. Either by using `aria-labelledby` or by adding `aria-hidden` to the static text if it doesn’t provide any additional value.

> That I think makes sense since just the aria-valuenow content (be it "Loading" or something similar) doesn't provide great context (what exactly is loading?).

Fully agree. "Loading" alone lacks the necessary context.

> 
> Though I might strongly recommend against it, if `aria-hidden` is being passed to a Spinner, that should somewhat resolve the issue of having a default aria-label applied. While the aria-label will still be there, the Spinner won't be in the a11y tree.
> 

No doubts, I’ve got a long road ahead on my accessibility learning journey, as this issue has proven. That said, in my tests, when `aria-hidden` is applied, the entire Spinner is removed from the accessibility tree, including its `aria-label` (checked with Chrome and Firefox developer tools) .

> I do think we can tweak the Spinner code so that the default value of aria-label is rendered in the props table, though.

Again, thank you for your enlightening explanation and please excuse me for reporting this as an issue when it clearly wasn’t one 🙏

It's better to raise an issue that may turn out to be intended behavior than have something sneak by us, so absolutely no worries opening this! We don't know what we don't know and all, and whether it leads to us fixing/adding something to improve the user experience or just a good discussion, it's worth it.

I'll edit your original comment just to note what this issue should go towards resolving (updating how we're defining the default value). If you'd be interested in working on it just let me know and I can assign you (no pressure to, though), otherwise I can put a "good first issue" label for others to pick it up.
Yep exactly what I was thinking! And we can add a console warning if both aria-label and aria-labelledby are falsey, we do that in some other components and could make sense here as well.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs.

issueDTO.title: Select examples should have aria-selected="false" for non-selected items
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the enhancement or change**
Followup to https://github.com/patternfly/patternfly/pull/5663

The [Option single select example](https://www.patternfly.org/components/menus/menu/html#option-single-select) and [option multi select example](https://www.patternfly.org/components/menus/menu/html#option-multi-select) on the Menu HTML page need the following updates:

We can update the a11y docs to include the aria attributes here as well, rather than adding them to the HTML "Accessibility" table (which would be removed anyway inf avor of the a11y docs). I'll open an issue in org for this.

issueDTO.title: Remove react-native-nitro-modules from the jazz-tools deps
issueDTO.description:
A user reported issues when using the jazz-tools into a [onestack](https://onestack.dev/) project:

```
ERROR  Build failed with 1 error:
node_modules/react-native-nitro-modules/lib/module/views/getHostComponent.js:5:41: ERROR: Cannot read file: /app/react-native-web/Libraries/NativeComponent/NativeComponentRegistry

    at failureErrorWithLog (node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:1477:15)
    at node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:946:25
    at node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:1355:9
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:105:5) 
```

We probably don't need it as direct depencency for `jazz-tools` and can be removed along with `react-native-quick-crypto`

We currently need it only for [Quick Crypto](https://jazz.tools/docs/react-native-expo/project-setup/providers#quick-crypto) which requires anyway the installation of those deps in the user project.

The idea is to try to mark `react-native-quick-crypto` and `react-native-nitro-modules` as optional peer dependencies and see if it's still possible to enable Quick Crypto in an Expo project (we can try with `chat-rn-expo`)
comments:
We also noticed that op-sqlite weights 100Mb of download, and probably expo-sqlite is also heavy.

It would be good to check if all the react-native deps can be moved to peerDependencies without issues.

exporter/awss3

We want to separate data storage at the bucket level in S3, based on resource attributes. Currently, this requires us to configure a new exporter each time a new bucket is introduced, which becomes difficult to manage at scale.

I'm not very familiar with Go, so I'm hoping the owners can take this on. I assume this feature would be relatively straightforward to implement, given that similar logic already exists for s3_prefix.

issueDTO.title: No short path literals
issueDTO.description:
## TLDR

In expressions, `foo/bar` bad, `./foo/bar` good

## Is your feature request related to a problem?

Most path literal expressions start with `./` in practice. (if not `../`)
This is a good practice because it makes it clear from the start what's the role of the text that follows.

In fact the use of path literal expressions like `foo/bar.nix` is sufficiently rare that experienced Nixers are unaware of this possibility (https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/pull/413892)

Perhaps the time has come to take this convention.

## Proposed solution

1. Add a setting to warn or fail when a relative path is encountered that does not start with a `.`
2. After some time, default the setting to warn by default

I'd stop there, so that we can keep evaluating old expressions without significant intervention.
Opting out of an error may be hard when multiple hosts are involved in a deployment process that involves evaluation.

## Alternative solutions

**Linting**. This is far less effective. We want everyone to stop using this syntax, not just those who have the knowledge and headspace for it, and we want good coverage; not just the projects that have integrated tooling.

## Additional context

- Similar to https://github.com/NixOS/nix/issues/8738

- A language redesign could parse `./foo/bar` as syntax sugar for `${.}/foo/bar` or `(.)/foo` or something. We can't do that because we want to stay compatible, and that involves parsing things like `foo/bar` directly as a path literal anyway.

## Checklist

<!-- make sure this issue is not redundant or obsolete -->

- [ ] checked [latest Nix manual] \([source])
- [ ] checked [open feature issues and pull requests] for possible duplicates

[latest Nix manual]: https://nixos.org/manual/nix/unstable/
[source]: https://github.com/NixOS/nix/tree/master/doc/manual/source
[open feature issues and pull requests]: https://github.com/NixOS/nix/labels/feature

---

Add :+1: to [issues you find important](https://github.com/NixOS/nix/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+sort%3Areactions-%2B1-desc).
comments:
Discussed in Nix team meeting today
- Good idea
- A formatter could auto-fix this

Implementation would be similar to that of the url syntax deprecation.
@cole-h That's right. Added a little tldr at the top.

This issue has been mentioned on **NixOS Discourse**. There might be relevant details there:

https://discourse.nixos.org/t/2025-06-25-nix-team-meeting-minutes-232/66102/1
I'd go even further and would appreciate a flag to warn or error on `..` (upwards path) components. They're clearly a code smell. Related discussion: https://github.com/NixOS/nix/issues/7338

This repo would be a counterexample of sorts. Meson imposes similar rules, but they don't translate to the same rules at the Nix level, and we are forced to either use `..` or put all our expression in the repo root. Another alternative is to pass the repo root as an argument, but I don't believe that's any more clear than `..`.
Disallowing `..` can perhaps be a good constraint on file layout and expression architecture, but then it should be a local setting (e.g. in a flake `nixConfig` or something similar). It's not necessarily confusing or wrong, but depends on circumstances and taste.

There are many steps in between using bare paths and full-on module system, but the more modular you get the less anything but subdirectories makes sense for decomposition. I agree it should be a local convention or setting, but that would still need a way to enforce it through the evaluator.

repository.name: nix

The use of path literal expressions like `foo/bar.nix` is sufficiently rare that experienced Nixers are unaware of this possibility.

This can be done by parsing 'foo/bar' as syntax sugar for '${.}/foo/bar' or '(.)/foo' or something.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is related to a problem where most path literal expressions start with './' in practice, which is a good practice to make it clear what's the role of the text that follows. The proposed solution is to add a setting to warn or fail when a relative path is encountered that does not start with a '.', and after some time, default the setting to warn by default.

issueDTO.title: Refactor getByKey() in PropertyService
issueDTO.description:
The current implementation of `getByKey()` in the [PropertyService](https://github.com/ghostfolio/ghostfolio/blob/main/apps/api/src/services/property/property.service.ts) relies on explicit type casting (e.g., `as string[]` in [AdminService](https://github.com/ghostfolio/ghostfolio/blob/main/apps/api/src/app/admin/admin.service.ts)).

```
const customCurrencies = (await this.propertyService.getByKey(PROPERTY_CURRENCIES)) as string[];
```

To enhance type safety and readability, the method should leverage _TypeScript_ generics to explicitly define the expected return type.

```
const customCurrencies = await this.propertyService.getByKey<string[]>(PROPERTY_CURRENCIES);
```

### Implementation Details

* Refactor the `getByKey()` method itself to accept a generic type
* Adapt all existing usages of `getByKey()` and eliminate the casting
comments: @dtslvr, I'll take a look!

repository.name: ghostfolio

summary.main: The current implementation of `getByKey()` in the PropertyService relies on explicit type casting, which needs to be refactored to leverage TypeScript generics and eliminate type casting, enhancing type safety and readability in the codebase.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the `getByKey()` method to return the expected type without explicit type casting, ensuring type safety and readability in the codebase.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by refactoring the `getByKey()` method in the PropertyService to accept a generic type and eliminate explicit type casting. Existing usages of `getByKey()` should be adapted to leverage the new generic type.

A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with before/after code snippets or explanations if possible.

issueDTO.title: Config flashes before "Loading" screen on subdomains
issueDTO.description:
When opening page on a subdomain for the first time, config flashes at the bottom of the page:

> [screen-recorder-fri-dec-13-2024-17-29-57.webm](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/899f9c22-5489-4ba6-ae0a-0687f7d89c9a)


This likely occurs when default index.html loads in iframe to read config. 
We should hide entire DOM if URL is landing page (no path, no subdomain).
comments: Can you assign me this issue, I would love to resolve this.
@Winter-Soren please feel free to work on this and open a PR :)

This seems to be happening again on inbrowser.link and .dev.

Let's take an opportunity to  improve the UI.

Good idea from @autonome:

> would be super cool if that interstitial had all website ui removed, just be a loading animation in the middle, with a very short msg communicating the value of the wait

related ideas:
- reuse fullscreen animation from the header of  [helia.io](https://helia.io/)?  
- reuse heartbeat css from ipfs-companion?
- have text that says "initializing Service Worker... TIP: visit `inbrowser.link` to adjust settings" ?

@lidel We *have* to show the iframe or it wont load config from global domain. do we still want that functionality?

config iframe started showing again in https://github.com/ipfs/service-worker-gateway/pull/677

One thing we can do with config loading from root that I forgot about until just now was the get config JSON call to the SW.. instead of loading the UI (dealing with defaults, async loading issues, and UI delays, etc.) the iframe config should simply query the SW-config `await fetch('?ipfs-sw-config-get=true')` and post that to the subdomain page (the parent of the iframe)..

Can we return an HTML page that simply handles "postMessage" directly from the service worker...? e.g.

```
<iframe src=`${parentDomain}?ipfs-sw-config-get-for-subdomain=true` />
```

> We have to show the iframe or it wont load config from global domain

This seems to fail sporadically. For example, when loading `/ipns/vitalik.eth` (I made sure the origin's local data was cleared before), it seems like there's a race condition and it doesn't have enough time for the config to load from the main origin (see the `enableRecursiveGateways` config).

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/20d20eae-92ca-450f-af7e-746340d10b63)

> the iframe config should simply query the SW-config await fetch('?ipfs-sw-config-get=true') and post that to the subdomain page (the parent of the iframe)

This sounds like a good idea both from a UX perspective as it would reduce the rendering overhead incurred by loading the config UI. 

However, if we cannot get config to reliably load from the root domain (`inbrowser.link`), I think global config is more misleading than helpful.

This probably needs to be revisited after #757 is addressed.

Have static HTML+CSS that by default shows loading screen, so if it flashes during those redirects, then it is a meaningful loading message, and not a janky UI flash.

Anecdotally, https://bafkreibm6jg3ux5qumhcn2b3flc3tyu6dmlb4xa7u5bf44yegnrjhc4yeq.ipfs.inbrowser.link/  on cold load requires fetching 2.4MiB and takes 2.86 seconds on my 500Mbit fiber and ~12s on 3G

this should be fixed with the latest deployment of v1.13.4 to inbrowser.dev: https://github.com/ipfs/service-worker-gateway/actions/runs/15902783209

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e916380a-d90e-4940-b436-008ab3fe1d35

Nice, way better experience than seeing a full-frame of content!

Is there a way to remove the first icon flash?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/067182d0-3f16-4984-a08f-d2a8e8d916a5)

@autonome it's currently hardcoded in the HTML, so it shows 3 times currently with v1.13.4: 
1. on first hit to subdomain (html,css,js downloaded, browser renders content, runs js, redirects to root)
2. on hit to root domain (same scenario as above, except you may have css/html/js cached in your browser, and redirects to subdomain with config values)
3. on final landing on subdomain, assets are cached, and the content of the page is displayed while SW is registered, and `window.location.replace` is called that is intercepted by the SW

So I am thinking I can delay showing the loading icon entirely until that last item above.

Happy to go with what users are thinking will work best.. or any clever solutions to render something more pleasing to the eye. I'll be trying to get some live feedback from @2color and @lidel on this sometime this week too.

> [@autonome](https://github.com/autonome) it's currently hardcoded in the HTML, so it shows 3 times currently with v1.13.4:
> 
> So I am thinking I can delay showing the loading icon entirely until that last item above.

+1

doing any work before the first redirect in the worst case scenario (nothing cached) guarantees a worse visual experience, since another redirect (visual flash) is guaranteed.

pushing all work to after 2nd redirect _might_ be better, but would need some testing to understand whether it could cause too long of a delay with no visual indicator at all.

>  redirects to subdomain with config values

(sorry i'm out of the loop on this work, feel free to link me to something to rtfm)

what are these values and why can't they shipped out to the client w/o the double redirect?

> > redirects to subdomain with config values > > (sorry i'm out of the loop on this work, feel free to link me to something to rtfm) > > what are these values and why can't they shipped out to the client w/o the double redirect? The config values determine some of the parameters for Verified Fetch and how retrieval works: We currently redirect so that users can change the configuration for subdomain origins, e.g. `cid.ipfs.inbrowser.link`. The reason we do this is because it's not clear from a UX perspective how to best allow users to change configuration for subdomains without modifying the verified response. The "insider way to do this is to append `/#/ipfs-sw-config` to the subdomain URI which will load the config page. @SgtPooki and I discussed some ideas on how to solve this: - Add a query parameter to disable the config redirect - Removing the config redirect by default (also a minor perf win) - Using the IPFS Companion extension to detect the SW and either allowing config from there or a button linking you to the config hash fragment

repository.description: IPFS Gateway implemented in Service Worker
repository.name: service-worker-gateway

summary.main: When opening a page on a subdomain for the first time, the config flashes at the bottom of the page. This likely occurs when the default index.html loads in an iframe to read the config. The issue needs to be fixed so that the config is loaded smoothly without flashing.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the config to be loaded smoothly without flashing. The issue needs to be fixed so that the config is visually centered horizontally across all screen sizes without breaking responsiveness or causing regression on other header elements.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented using the iframe config to query the SW-config and post it to the subdomain page. One idea is to reuse the fullscreen animation from the header of helia.io or reuse the heartbeat CSS from ipfs-companion. Another idea is to have a loading animation in the middle with a short message communicating the value of the wait.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is related to the Service Worker Gateway, specifically the loading of config on subdomains. The issue is described as the config flashing before the 'Loading' screen on subdomains. The expected behavior is for the config to be loaded smoothly without flashing. The fix can be implemented by hiding the entire DOM if the URL is a landing page (no path, no subdomain).

issueDTO.title: 🐛 Default xidb zone_setting with dbtool produces xi_map intermittent failure
issueDTO.description:
<!-- Remove space and place 'x' mark between square [] brackets or click the checkbox after saving to affirm the following points: -->
<!-- (it should look like this: - [x] I have ...) -->
**_I affirm:_**
- [x] I understand that if I do not agree to the following points by completing the checkboxes my issue will be ignored.
- [x] I have read and understood the [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/LandSandBoat/server/blob/base/CONTRIBUTING.md) and the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/LandSandBoat/server/blob/base/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
- [x] I have searched existing [issues](https://github.com/LandSandBoat/server/issues) to see if the issue has already been opened, and I have checked the commit log to see if the issue has been resolved since my server was last updated.

## OS / platform the server is running (if known)

<!-- Windows10 / Ubuntu / Mac / ARM etc -->
Windows 11

## Branch affected by issue <!-- Change to the branch the issue exists on (if relevant) -->

`base`

## Steps to reproduce

<!-- Add steps to reproduce here -->
1. Default xidb
2. Build xi_*
3. ...\server\tools> py -3 dbtool.py
4. l (launch server)
5. Observe launched two xi_map.exe:
```
...
Launching D:\Projects\LandSandBoatAJBats\server\xi_map.exe --log log/map-server-0.log --ip 127.0.0.1 --port 0
Launching D:\Projects\LandSandBoatAJBats\server\xi_map.exe --log log/map-server-54230.log --ip 127.0.0.1 --port 54230
```

An instance for port 0 zone and port 54230 both attempt to start and race each other. One will fail because even the xi_map started with `--port 0` will still bind to port 54230, and thus the "loser" sees:
 
```
[06/29/25 18:39:27:886][map][critical] Failed to create MapSocket: bind: Only one usage of each socket address (protocol/network address/port) is normally permitted. (MapNetworking::MapNetworking:104)
```

This is because of the way dbtool launches zones per unique port specified in xidb, but there is zone 286 which has port 0 because it is a bad zone.

So if your setting up a brand new db with defaults on a new server with defaults, dbtool sets you up for a race condition.

## Expected behavior

<!-- Add expected behavior here -->
Out of the box xidb and dbtool should reliably start xi_map for all supported zones.
comments:
Yeah confirmed:
```sql
SELECT DISTINCT zoneport from zone_settings ORDER BY zoneport ASC;
```

returns: 0, 54230

because of:

```sql
INSERT INTO `zone_settings` VALUES (286,0,'127.0.0.1',0,'286',0,0,0,0,0,0.00,0); -- Crashes the client if enabled and you try to go there
```

In this section:
`dbtool.py`
```py
def launch_using_zone_settings():
    result = db_query("SELECT DISTINCT zoneip FROM xidb.zone_settings;")

    zoneip = result.stdout.split("\n")[1]

    result = db_query(
        f"""
        SELECT DISTINCT zoneport from zone_settings ORDER BY zoneport ASC;
        """
    )

    ports = result.stdout.split("\n")[1:-1]

    print(f"ZoneIP: {zoneip}, Ports: {ports}\n")
```

We probably want to strit out any entries in `ports` that are 0.

Maybe something like this (Thanks GitHub Copilot):
```py
    # Strip out any '0' entries from ports
    ports = [port for port in ports if port.strip() != '0']
```

issueDTO.title: Talk back is not reading Arabic language in Audio Language dialog box
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
Talk back is not reading Arabic language in Audio Language dialog box 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Place Values'
2. Double tap on 'What are place values'
3. Double tap on 'Audio' button
4. Double tap on 'Change language' icon
5. Audio Language dialog box appears
6. Swipe across the various languages

**Expected behavior**
Talk back to read all the language names including Arabic


**Environment**
Device name: One plus Nord2 5G
Android version : Android 11
App version : 0.7-alpha-d1b2827517

**Explanation and suggested solution**
In `LanguageDialogFragment`, we use ` appLanguageResourceHandler.computeLocalizedDisplayName(audioLanguage)` to get the display name for ecah language. The Arabic language therefore is displayed in Arabic characters, which talkback, when localized to English, cannot read. 

Talkback relies on content descriptions where available, but since this list is dynamic, we can use an accessibility delegate to instruct talkback on how to read Arabic(and Hindi too).

When creating the dialog, override the accessibility properties of the list items by accessing the AlertDialog's ListView after creation:

```kotlin
val options = languageNameArrayList.toTypedArray<CharSequence>()
val languageInterface: LanguageInterface = parentFragment as AudioFragment

val alertDialog = AlertDialog.Builder(ContextThemeWrapper(activity as Context, R.style.OppiaDialogFragmentTheme))
  ...
    .create()

alertDialog.setOnShowListener {
    val listView = alertDialog.listView
    for (i in 0 until listView.childCount) {
        val item = listView.getChildAt(i)
        item?.setAccessibilityDelegate(object : View.AccessibilityDelegate() {
            override fun onInitializeAccessibilityNodeInfo(
                host: View?,
                info: AccessibilityNodeInfo?
            ) {
                super.onInitializeAccessibilityNodeInfo(host, info)
                // Get the item text
           
                // Set content description for TalkBack
                        }
        })
    }
}

return alertDialog

```

UI tests are expected for the submitted code.
comments: For searching context, this issue was found in 0.7-alpha (MR4).

@Vishwajith-Shettigar, could you please test and leave a comment whether this issue is still occurring in the playstore version of the app?
 
 You could also test with the development version on the develop branch, using the fractions topic. @MohitGupta121  should be able to help in case you have any questions

@adhiamboperes yes I think this issue is already fixed, I checked and found Talkback reading Arabic language text. 

https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/assets/76530270/e282d114-4037-4b7b-9f14-931261a90986
Hi @MohitGupta121, once you get the production assets set up, please verify this with the correct lesson per the issue description, thanks!

@adhiamboperes yes you are right there is a issue, here is updated screen recording:


https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/assets/76530270/de39e595-e467-4a6c-944b-fcd3f47031c6
@elin4046, you can work on this

Hi @adhiamboperes, this is the approach that I'm planning to take:

**Issue** 
Currently, Talkback will read the list of languages using the device's configured TTS language setting (see screenshot for this setting). For devices where this setting is not set to Arabic, this results in any Arabic words being skipped.

![Screenshot 2024-07-12 at 12 38 19 PM](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/17b33f5d-1e10-4ab2-b33b-042bbd90f4c9)

Additionally, the current behavior means that the other languages in the list _aren't_ being read in their native TTS languages, which can be confusing to understand (eg. the Chinese characters for Mandarin Chinese are read in a hard-to-understand English TTS 'accent'). 

**Proposed Approach**
Update `AppLanguageResourceHandler::computeLocalizedDisplayName` so that it returns a `SpannableString` instead of a `String` and wrap the returned string with `LocaleString.` By doing so, we can specify a locale that allows TalkBack to dyanmically switch to the proper TTS voice based on the language. This change would also require updating the `OptionsAudioLanguageViewModel` and `AudioLanguageSelectionViewModel` display language property to use `SpannableString` instead of `String.` 

Let me know if these are the methods/files that should be updated in this fix, thanks!

Hi @elin4046, thanks for researching this. I have a few follow ups:
- Typically, we don't use Locale directly in the codebase. However, if you can create a function in  the `OppiaLocale` class, it might work.
- Configuring locale specific tts voice is technically out of scope for this issue. However, if it is an automatic side effect of the fix, then we can test it out and get product feedback on it. 


Do you mind  trying this fix and doing a screen recording so we can see what it is like?

**Additional Context**
The Oppia app is set up to use the device language by default, and if the device is configure in mandarin for example, most tts will be in mandarin. However, for app strings, mandarin is not one of the translated languages we currently support, and talkback relies on content descriptions to describe the app, so for untranslated strings will default to English.
@theayushyadav11, here's another issue to look at.

Hey @adhiamboperes,thanks for considering me for this work.
I’m currently unable to reproduce the **_Place Values_** screen on the app installed via Android Studio, even though it’s accessible in the version downloaded from the Play Store. Could you kindly guide me on how to test this screen using the app installed through Android Studio?
@theayushyadav11, thanks for letting me know. The lesson is currently not available on the developer version. We may have to test this using a differnt lesson like Fractions or Ratios.
Hi @adhiamboperes , currently there is no option available for arabic language in Fractions or Ratios.

Thanks @theayushyadav11. It seems that this issue is currently blocked. It may be best to work on a different issue until we can reproduce this on the development environment
Thanks for taking a look!
@subhajitxyz, is this a different issue from the one you fixed in https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/pull/5613?

> [@subhajitxyz](https://github.com/subhajitxyz), is this a different issue from the one you fixed in [#5613](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/pull/5613)?

Yes. This is a different issue.

issueDTO.title: Erdős Problem 43
issueDTO.description:
### What is the conjecture
    
https://www.erdosproblems.com/43

  If $A,B\subset \{1,\ldots,N\}$ are two Sidon sets such that $(A-A)\cap(B-B)=\{0\}$ then is it true that 
$$\binom{\lvert A\rvert}{2}+\binom{\lvert B\rvert}{2}\leq\binom{f(N)}{2}+O(1) $$,
where $f(N)$ is the maximum possible size of a Sidon set in $\{1,\ldots,N\}$? If $\lvert A\rvert=\lvert B\rvert$ then can this bound be improved to

$$\binom{\lvert A\rvert}{2}+\binom{\lvert B\rvert}{2}\leq (1-c)\binom{f(N)}{2}$$
for some constant $c>0$?

Status: open

### Prerequisites needed
None, Sidon sets is already in `ForMathlib`

issueDTO.title: [BUG]: Buf Lint Script Does Not resolve Darwin-arm64 execs (for Apple Silicon Macs)
issueDTO.description:
### Describe the bug

In https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/blob/develop/scripts/buf_lint_check.sh, the script only looks for `buf-Darwin-x86_64`, but for Apple Silicon Macs, the correct file is `buf-Darwin-arm64`.

We need a check around line 35 to make the distinction between the two chips.

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Ensure pre-push checks are set up properly on your Mac by running ` bash scripts/setup.sh`
2. Push a commit using `git push -u`
3. See that the pre-push checks fail with the error below:

```bash
********************************
scripts/buf_lint_check.sh: line 15: ../oppia-android-tools/buf-Darwin-x86_64: No such file or directory
********************************
Protobuf lint check issues found. Please fix them before pushing your code.
********************************
error: failed to push some refs to 'github.com:oppia/oppia-android.git'
```


### Expected Behavior

Pre-push checks should pass if there are no lint issues.

### Screenshots/Videos

_No response_

### What device/emulator are you using?

_No response_

### Which Android version is your device/emulator running?

_No response_

### Which version of the Oppia Android app are you using?

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_
comments:
On further investigation, the `BUFVERSION="v0.37.1"` that we are using in `buf_download.sh` does not contain a `buf-Darwin-arm64` asset([see here](https://github.com/bufbuild/buf/releases/tag/v0.37.1)). This asset was first introduced in `v0.42.0` ([see here](https://github.com/bufbuild/buf/releases/tag/v0.42.0)). Updating this value in the script fixes this issue for me(in addition to adding the check mentioned in the main issue body).

In older versions of MacOS, this error did not occur. But I am currently using 15.5.

repository.description: A free online & offline learning platform to make quality education accessible for all.
repository.name: oppia-android

summary.main: The buf lint script does not resolve Darwin-arm64 execs for Apple Silicon Macs, causing pre-push checks to fail. The issue needs to be fixed to ensure the script correctly identifies and handles the `buf-Darwin-arm64` file on Apple Silicon Macs.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the pre-push checks to pass if there are no lint issues, which means the script should correctly identify and handle the `buf-Darwin-arm64` file on Apple Silicon Macs.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by updating the `BUFVERSION` value in `buf_download.sh` to a version that contains the `buf-Darwin-arm64` asset, which was first introduced in `v0.42.0`. Additionally, a check should be added around line 35 in `buf_lint_check.sh` to make the distinction between `buf-Darwin-x86_64` and `buf-Darwin-arm64` for Apple Silicon Macs.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is labeled as 'bug' and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with before/after screenshots or video if possible.

issueDTO.title: Normalize contribution docs with Briefcase
issueDTO.description:
### What is the problem or limitation you are having?

Toga has a contribution guide for docs and code; so does Briefcase. However, there are some elements of the Briefcase docs that would be useful to include in the Toga docs.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Replicate the sections of the Briefcase contribution guides that aren't Briefcase-specific in the Toga docs. The one section I've noticed in particular is the discussion about running CI checks locally as part of the PR submission process; there may be others.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Consolidate these docs upstream (on the beeware.org website) so that the content isn't duplicated unnecessarily. However, developing a good narrative flow with an external site like that may be complex.


### Additional context

See also beeware/briefcase#1696, beeware/rubicon-objc#427
comments: Having a single source for the identical portions would save work in the future, and prevent them from inevitably drifting apart again.

Absolutely agreed - the issue I have is the end-user ergonomics of needing 2 documents - a "these are the general rules" document, and a "this is how this specific project works" document, and how to maintain a narrative flow that doesn't result in people getting lost or requiring duplication. 

One idea that occurred to me - although I have no idea how it would be implemented - would be to use a common *source* document, and include chunks of that common source as required. That would have the benefit of keeping the Briefcase docs on the Briefcase page, but would ensure that multiple versions say aligned.

Thinking out loud....

What if we leverage git submodules?

In this way, a new repo would contain the common documentation and the project repos would add this new repo as a submodule; then the docs could be built using a single source of truth for common documentation.

For instance: https://github.com/davidfischer/sphinx-with-submodules

Put together a quick PoC.

In a [copy](https://github.com/rmartin16/briefcase-test) of the Briefcase repo, I added a new [repo](https://github.com/rmartin16/beeware-common-docs-test) as a [submodule](https://github.com/rmartin16/briefcase-test/tree/main/docs) in the `docs` directory. Then, I [reference](https://github.com/rmartin16/briefcase-test/blob/467fafe36679c579c0400f20603654295785e2a1/docs/index.rst?plain=1#L18) the `common-1.rst` file from the Briefcase's `index.rst`.

project repo: https://github.com/rmartin16/briefcase-test
common doc repo: https://github.com/rmartin16/beeware-common-docs-test

This all works rather seamlessly, IMO. There will need to be a workflow to bump the submodule commit in the project repos when the common doc repo is updated, though.

[edit] I guess a major issue this is likely to create is unaware contributors trying to build docs without the submodule....since `git` apparently doesn't clone submodules by default. So, anyone trying to build docs will need to run `git submodule update --init` or have run `git clone --recurse-submodules` initially...

> What if we leverage git submodules?

That's definitely one way to avoid reproducing content; I'm not sure how I feel about it, though. I've historically avoided submodules unless I absolutely have to use them - I've found them to be one of those features that superficially works, but ends up making your life a whole lot more complicated in the long run (especially for contributors that haven't got experience with submodules - which is most of them).

At the risk of re-inventing the wheel - I wonder if it might be more reliable to use the same general approach, but build the subrepo cloning part as a build pre-processing step using regular git cloning.

> I've found them to be one of those features that superficially works, but ends up making your life a whole lot more complicated in the long run (especially for contributors that haven't got experience with submodules - which is most of them).

This is fair and definitely one of my concerns for a submodule.

> At the risk of re-inventing the wheel - I wonder if it might be more reliable to use the same general approach, but build the subrepo cloning part as a build pre-processing step using regular git cloning.

hmm...this definitely ventures in to wheel reinvention territory.

While this approach avoids the submodule, it introduces ambiguities that the submodule makes explicit. Notably, the current version of the "common docs" incorporated in to any single project's published docs is implicit. Now, we can create workflows around ensuring any updates committed to the "common docs" are more or less immediately pushed to dependent repos....but that doesn't remove the inherent implicit nature of which version of the "common docs" is being used.

Alternatively, if we're willing to automate the management of pulling and building docs from a remote repo, then it seems much more trivial to simply have `tox` ensure the submodule is initialized and updated prior to building the docs....rather than trying to manually clone a repo and add it to the project's docs.

But, even then, the "common docs" commit used for the submodule in a project repo still needs to be maintained. So, either way, we need a process to ensure updates in the "common docs" are disseminated to relevant repos and their docs are republished.

Given the submodule is only necessary to build the docs...and the only real way to build the docs is to run `tox`, I think much of the concern of contributors getting caught up in having to understand submodules can be avoided. That said, I don't have strong feelings and don't have much experience managing a submodule over time.

> > At the risk of re-inventing the wheel - I wonder if it might be more reliable to use the same general approach, but build the subrepo cloning part as a build pre-processing step using regular git cloning.
> 
> hmm...this definitely ventures in to wheel reinvention territory.
> 
> While this approach avoids the submodule, it introduces ambiguities that the submodule makes explicit.

That would depend a bit on the implementation - we could make our implementation use specific git hash or similar. However, at the very least, a non-trivial re-implementation of a not-insignificant portion of git submodules would be required.

> Given the submodule is only necessary to build the docs...and the only real way to build the docs is to run `tox`, I think much of the concern of contributors getting caught up in having to understand submodules can be avoided. 

That's a fair point. My experience is that the core git submodule implementation "works" - it's just near-impossible for a normal human to consistently drive correctly. These problems stem from the fact that submodules aren't deeply integrated into the "default" git workflow, so you end up with stale checkouts, or incompatible checkouts, or something else like that. 

If we can make the existence of the submodules completely transparent to the end user - so running `tox e docs/docs-lint/docs-live` *completely* manages submodule cloning, updating, etc; and the existence of the submodule doesn't impact on any other development behavior (e.g., causing issues switching between branches), then this might be an approach worth pursuing.

A sync between the Toga and Briefcase contribution guides is in progress. 

There is a somewhat significant amount of duplicated content between the two code contribution guides, and the documentation guides are 99.9% the same. I feel the idea of consolidating content is a discussion worth continuing.

I put some time into looking into whether there were any options, inherent to Sphinx, available for consolidating content. As far as I can tell, Sphinx does not support any features that would do this natively. Directly cloning the repo would avoid submodules, but the issue of being able to edit the common docs in the wrong location seems as possible with this method as with submodules. Other than this issue, the rest could be made relatively transparent to the user.

Another issue that came up is searchability. Users have reported that it's difficult to find info with the docs being spread across multiple repos. Something that is worth looking into for this are [Read the Docs subprojects](https://docs.readthedocs.com/platform/stable/subprojects.html). This would require having a "primary" documentation repo, perhaps on `beeware/beeware`, that the rest of the tools are added to as subprojects. Then, the docs would be searchable across all projects - the project-wide search is available from the "primary" project, as well as any of the subprojects. The search has a checkbox for "Include subprojects" and that is how you choose to search all the projects at once - there is an [active issue](https://github.com/readthedocs/addons/issues/22) open to add the ability to configure it to be checked by default. This change may effect some of the plan [here](https://github.com/beeware/beeware/discussions/522#discussioncomment-13502604), so it's something we would need to discuss.

> Another issue that came up is searchability. Users have reported that it's difficult to find info with the docs being spread across multiple repos.

Once the docs are all moved to beeware.org subdomains, it'll become possible to do this with an external search engine that supports filtering by domain, e.g. Google has `site:beeware.org`.

issueDTO.title: [Feature request]: Ensure Help Documentation is Updated and Accurate for All Tutorial Steps
issueDTO.description:
### Problem: What is happening?

Devopness provides a tutorial that guides users through key workflows, such as adding projects, environments, servers, applications, and more. The tutorial is available in the [Devopness Guide][1]. To support users during these workflows, help documentation is displayed via the `?` buttons on various pages.

However, several challenges have been identified:
1. **Missing Documentation**: Some pages accessed during the tutorial do not have associated help documentation, leaving users without guidance when they need it most.
2. **Incorrect Documentation Paths**: Certain help articles exist but are not properly linked, making them inaccessible via the `?` button.
3. **Outdated Instructions**: Some help documentation reflects older UI/UX flows that have since been updated, causing confusion for users who rely on these instructions.

This issue aims to address these challenges by ensuring all tutorial steps and key pages have complete, accurate, and actionable help documentation. By doing so, we can enhance the onboarding experience, provide clarity, and ensure users can complete workflows efficiently.

### Expected behavior

All tutorial steps and key pages should have complete, accurate, and actionable help documentation accessible via the `?` buttons. Users should be able to follow workflows without confusion or interruption.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to the [Devopness tutorial](https://devopness.com/docs).
2. Navigate through the tutorial steps (e.g., projects, environments, servers).
3. Click on the ? button for help documentation on pages listed in the issue (e.g., projects/list-projects, teams/list-teams).
4. Observe whether the expected help documentation is available or accessible.

We would like a new entry on the term `.arange()` in NumPy built-in functions. The entry should go in `content/numpy/concepts/built-in-functions/terms/arange/arange.md`

- A description of the term

issueDTO.title: 2025 Spring AI Alibaba 技术博客/视频征集
issueDTO.description:
### Description

如果您在调研或者使用Spring AI Alibaba和Jmanus，欢迎<font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">大家用自己擅长的方式创作Spring AI Alibaba/Jmanus相关作品，并通过技术博客或者短视频分享Spring AI Alibaba/Jmanus的介绍、技术解析、最佳实践、使用案例。</font>

## 参与方式:
1.撰写技术博客或者制作视频，发布至个人博客、CSDN等开发者社区、B站、视频号等视频平台。
2.将文章/视频地址发布至此 issue 评论区。
3.投稿后通过这个地址[提交个人收件信息](https://survey.aliyun.com/apps/zhiliao/aX4Z_BS8a)



## 奖品说明
1. 社区参与奖（数量不限）：只要投稿的作者就可以获得阿里巴巴开源纪念品，咖啡杯、T恤二选一
2. 优秀贡献奖（2名）：每月最后一个工作日，评委会根据投稿内容的技术先进性、内容可读性、文章/视频阅读量三个维度进行打分，评选出2位优秀贡献奖，奖品是无线手机充电支架。



## <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">投稿作品要求</font>
+ <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">作品层次结构及逻辑清晰且必须是原创；</font>
+ <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">禁止发布广告类内容信息；</font>
+ <font style="color:rgb(31, 35, 40);">禁止发布涉政、暴恐、违禁等敏感内容。</font>

issueDTO.title: Show “Add” button instead of “Edit” in Prescription section of Encounter when no medicines are listed
issueDTO.description: **Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.** In the prescription within an Encounter, the UI currently displays an “Edit” button even when no medicines have been added yet. This creates a confusing user experience, as there’s nothing to edit in such cases. **Describe the solution you'd like** - If the Medicines list is empty in the encounter, display an “Add” button instead of “Edit”. - If medicines are already present, continue showing the “Edit” button as usual. **Describe alternatives you've considered** A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered. **Additional context** Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here. --- ### 🚨 DO NOT EDIT BELOW THIS LINE 🚨 ### Instructions for Requesting Assignment: To request assignment, please clearly outline your solution and timeline by commenting on the issue using the format below: **Describe your solution clearly:** Provide a detailed explanation of your proposed solution, including your approach, key implementation steps, and relevant examples or references. Mention any dependencies, assumptions, or risks you foresee that might affect your timeline or implementation. **Expected Timeline:** - End date: [Expected submission date of a completed Pull Request] **Additional Context:** Include any other relevant context, links, screenshots, or resources that support your proposed solution. > 🚨 Your assignment may be unassigned if there is no activity or progress within the stated timeline unless communicated clearly and agreed upon.

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: Wrong modules  are builded for some board and kernels
issueDTO.description:
### What happened?

[My system  NanoPC-T6-LTS](https://paste.armbian.com/jozoreselu)
I have loaded linux headers per armbian-config and wrote simple module:
```
//only
module_init(sbl_init);
module_exit(sbl_exit);
```
Module is empty, only two methods.
Then i does insmod/rmmod and I have got errors.
```
andrey@NanoPC-T6-LTS:~/projects/linux-modules/sbl$ sudo insmod sbl.ko
andrey@NanoPC-T6-LTS:~/projects/linux-modules/sbl$ sudo rmmod sbl
rmmod: ERROR: ../libkmod/libkmod-module.c:856 kmod_module_remove_module() could not remove 'sbl': Device or resource busy
rmmod: ERROR: could not remove module sbl: Device or resource busy
```
dmesg is empty



### How to reproduce?

That error I have at kernels 6.1.75, 6.1.99, 6.6, 6.12.13 and so on. But don`t have error at 6.1.43 (NanoPC-T6-LTS) and any desktop x86 systems like ubuntu, kubuntu and so on.
Also other users have same [problem]( https://forum.armbian.com/topic/50406-very-simple-module-for-nothing-segmentation-fault/) on their boards.
This behavior has been going on for over 6 months. It is not possible to build a working module per armbian.

### Branch

main (main development branch)

### On which host OS are you running the build script and observing this problem?

Ubuntu 24.04 Noble

### Are you building on Windows WSL2?

- [ ] Yes, my Ubuntu/Debian/OtherOS is running on WSL2

### Relevant log URL

https://paste.armbian.com/jozoreselu

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
comments:
### Hey @seniorandre! 👋

Thanks for opening your first issue with the Armbian project — we’re glad to have you here! 🧡  
Your input doesn’t just help us improve the project — it benefits everyone who uses Armbian.

If you'd like to stay informed about project updates or collaborate more closely with the team,  
you can optionally share some personal contact preferences at [armbian.com/update-data](https://www.armbian.com/update-data/).  
This helps us keep in touch without relying solely on GitHub notifications.

Also, don’t forget to ⭐ star the repo to support the work — and welcome aboard! 🚀

Jira ticket: [AR-2703](https://armbian.atlassian.net/browse/AR-2703)

[AR-2703]: https://armbian.atlassian.net/browse/AR-2703?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

> Also other users have same [problem](https://forum.armbian.com/topic/50406-very-simple-module-for-nothing-segmentation-fault/) on their boards.

Thank you for sharing your findings. We’ve noticed that other users have reported similar issues, as seen in the forum thread you are mentioning. However, we kindly ask that such discussions be continued there in order to keep issues at one place and as this tracker is intended for framework-related issues. Once solution is found and its only a matter of integration, a PR https://github.com/armbian/build/pulls should be opened - by anyone.

This particular bug appears to be tied to the specific hardware/kernel combination and not related to Armbian OS or assembly itself. It's worth noting that this issue does not manifest on Raspberry Pi or x86 platforms, which benefit from significantly larger development resources — for instance, Raspberry Pi OS has a dedicated full-time staff and a yearly budget exceeding 1 million USD. In contrast, Armbian relies heavily on community support and volunteer contributions with budget ([taken from here](https://github.com/sponsors/armbian)). And we compile 80 different kernels for docents of platforms. Most of them are not even close to level of Raspberry Pi. And even there, users finds issues https://github.com/raspberrypi/linux/issues

As frustrating as it may be, the reality in open source is that some issues—especially those requiring deep investigation—can take years to resolve. We fully understand the inconvenience and appreciate your patience and contributions.

issueDTO.title: API client to throw error instead of None
issueDTO.description:
The Api client should  `raise_for_status()` instead of `None` if there is an error. Like this we can call the API client and give a more meaningful error to the user.

Things to consider:
* The API client should throw but the emissionsTracker should not break, this means that we should try-catch in the emissions tracker.
* One should check as well if in any of the responses we are `if response is None` because now they will throw the error

_Originally posted by @inimaz in https://github.com/mlco2/codecarbon/issues/798#issuecomment-2800035595_
comments: Would be happy to take this one if it's still relevant :)

Noticed a couple of other things when trying to get env setup. 

- project could benefit from using `uv` for dependency resolution (on install and pip compile)

eg. (not sure this is complete, more info [here](https://juftin.com/hatch-pip-compile/#configuration-options)

```
# pyproject.toml

[tool.hatch.envs.default]
# pip-compile automate the export of environments.txt
type = "pip-compile"
installer = "uv"
pip-compile-resolver = "uv"
```

- python3.8 tests do not work as installing `urllib==2.5.0` is not possible on py3.8
- test deps don't seem to be separated from build deps
- setting `CODECARBON_ALLOW_MULTIPLE_RUNS` env variable could be done with `pytest-dotenv` setting in `pytest.ini` and adding a `.env.test` file 

All except the second one are somewhat debatable, so not sure the best place to put them - happy to elaborate.

Hello @bcmyguest It is still relevant! Feel free to take it/ask for any questions.

- About the use of `uv`, I agree. I see @benoit-cty already started [a branch to migrate ](https://github.com/mlco2/codecarbon/pull/815) maybe it can be discussed in that PR?
- About test deps not separated from build deps. I think this is only true for the env `api`. Thanks for pointing out. We use it to deploy our API, we could separate it into `api-test` and `api`.
- And about the `pytest.ini`, indeed go ahead!

issueDTO.title: Allow to rename a module in a `ModuleSelect`
issueDTO.description:
I was writing some lustre code:
```gleam
html.form(
  [
    attribute.method("POST"),
    attribute.action("..."),
    attribute.enctype("..."),
  ],
  [...],
)
```
And thought I would like to change the `attribute` module and alias it to some other name (like `attr`). It would be really nice if triggering the rename action allowed us to alias (or change an existing alias) an imported module and automatically update all relevant module selects. Triggering the action here:

```gleam
html.form(
  [
    attribute.method("POST"),
//   ^^^^ I put my cursor here and trigger the rename
    attribute.action("..."),
    attribute.enctype("..."),
  ],
  [...],
)
```

Would result in this change:

```diff
- import lustre/attribute
+ import lustre/attribute as attr

html.form(
  [
-   attribute.method("POST"),
-   attribute.action("..."),
-   attribute.enctype("..."),
+   attr.method("POST"),
+   attr.action("..."),
+   attr.enctype("..."),
  ],
  [...],
)
```

What do you think?
comments: That makes sense to me. We already do that for unqualified imports
I dig it!
I'd like to give this a go!

issueDTO.title: “Something Went Wrong” Error Displayed During Email Login – Customer App
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
When attempting to log in using email in the customer app, an error message saying “Something went wrong” is displayed after tapping the login button. This happens even when valid credentials are used, preventing users from accessing their accounts.

**To Reproduce**

- Open the customer app
- Go to the login screen
- Enter a valid email and password
- Tap the Login button
- Observe the error: “Something went wrong”

**Expected behavior**
Users should be able to log in with valid credentials and be redirected to the app’s home screen. Any errors should be meaningful and guide the user (e.g., invalid credentials, network issue).

**Screenshots**

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ad51b2b0-c411-40d3-91f7-9c3f91840b2c

Smartphone (please complete the following information):

Device: Samsung A15

OS: Android 14

App Version: [insert if known]

**Additional context**
This issue may stem from a backend authentication failure, unhandled response, or a general catch-all error handler. It should be fixed and replaced with a clear, specific error message if the credentials are wrong, or resolved if the backend is functional.

issueDTO.title: Crash When Source is set to null
issueDTO.description:
# Bug
The app is crashing when the source prop is set to null (only on Windows). The issue persists on Debug and Release builds.
<!--
Very important, before opening a ticket:
    1) Ensure the issue has not been already reported
    2) lease test using the latest release (including 6.0.0 preRelease) of the library, as maybe the bug has been already fixed.
    3) please don't use emulator to reproduce issues. if you have strange or sporadic error check if this is not devices specific (understand that this library is just a binding to player).
    4) ensure you cannot solve the issue by yourself using following guide: https://github.com/react-native-video/react-native-video/blob/master/docs/DEBUGGING.md
-->

## Platform
* Windows

## Environment info
Library version: 6.0.0-alpha.6
Device: Windows 10 PC
react-native: 0.72.3
react-native-windows: 0.72.1


## Steps To Reproduce
1. Set the source prop to a local/hosted video
2. Change the source prop to null


## Expected behaviour
According to the documentation providing a null source value after loading a previous source will stop playback and clear out the previous source content.

1. Video component should clear the previous source. 

## Reproducible sample code
```
<Video
    source={null}
    style={{width:'100%', height:'100%'}}
    resizeMode={'contain'}
    onError={onError}
  />
```

## onError message
```
{"errorString":"invalid url, player will stop","errorCode":"INVALID_URL"}
```
## callstack
```
 	ucrtbase.dll!7597eddb()	Unknown
 	[Frames below may be incorrect and/or missing, no symbols loaded for ucrtbase.dll]	
 	[External Code]	
>	ReactNativeVideoCPP.dll!winrt::throw_hresult(const winrt::hresult result) Line 4966	C++
 	ReactNativeVideoCPP.dll!winrt::ReactNativeVideoCPP::implementation::ReactVideoViewManager::UpdateProperties(const winrt::Windows::UI::Xaml::FrameworkElement & view, const winrt::Microsoft::ReactNative::IJSValueReader & propertyMapReader) Line 97	C++
 	ReactNativeVideoCPP.dll!winrt::impl::produce<winrt::ReactNativeVideoCPP::implementation::ReactVideoViewManager,winrt::Microsoft::ReactNative::IViewManagerWithNativeProperties>::UpdateProperties(void * view, void * propertyMapReader) Line 6109	C++
```

issueDTO.title: preferredForwardBufferDuration not working. It doesn't change anything
issueDTO.description:
# Bug

<!--

In Android i was able to change the bufferConfig prop and i tested in a real Android device and it works, but in iOS, i changed the prop `preferredForwardBufferDuration` but the video still stop playing after some seconds because the loaded buffer isn't enough to continue playing the video. Moreover, i tested setting `automaticallyWaitsToMinimizeStalling` to false but it doesn't work. 
What i understood is that if i put `preferredForwardBufferDuration=15` it means that the player will load 15 video seconds into the memory before continue playing the video but it doesn't work like that. It seems that preferredForwardBufferDuration is always in 0

Unfortunately, this bug is not easy to reproduce, but I have witnessed it every time an ad has buffered while playing. Tapping the paused ad or otherwise changing the `isPlaying` state to `true` successfully resumes playback.

<!--

issueDTO.title: Logs initialization successful even if it fails
issueDTO.description: **Describe the bug** Initialization successful gets logged before the initialization is completed, meaning that the log message gets written even if it fails to initialize **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Get initiate_mission in isar-robot to raise an error 2. Schedule a mission **Expected behavior** Should only log if successful **Screenshots**
comments: This function runs before the robot package is done scheduling the mission Also note that first task gets reported as inProgress before the mission is even scheduled, including if the scheduling fails. Should wait until scheduling is completed. Suggest including that when fixing this. Could solve https://github.com/equinor/flotilla/issues/1604

summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the logs initialization to only log successful initialization, and not before the initialization is completed.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by modifying the logs initialization to only log successful initialization, and waiting until scheduling is completed before reporting the first task as inProgress.

手入力の場合データの一貫性的な意味では以下を必須にしたく（unique key）
```
- 都道府県 (日本語、enum)
- 市町村＋区
- 番号 (10-1のような「番号」「ハイフン」「番号」)
```

オプショナルで
```
- 名前（東小学校前、など）
- 状況（破損していました、など）
（以下はかなりオプショナル）
- 住所
- 緯度
- 経度
```
があると良さそうです（poster_boards のスキーマです）

issueDTO.title: Upgrade rust edition to 2024
issueDTO.description:
[Rust 2024](https://blog.rust-lang.org/2025/02/20/Rust-1.85.0/#rust-2024) ([full guide](https://doc.rust-lang.org/edition-guide/rust-2024/index.html)) is out, but the monorepo still uses Rust 2021.

I ran `cargo fix --edition` and there's quite a lot of changes that need to be inspected/reviewed. I don't think we can/should upgrade the edition until then.

To get a sense of the changes, here's logs of running `cargo fix --edition` on stable and then nightly.

* [stable](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20163227/cargo-fix-edition-stable.log)
* [nightly](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20163228/cargo-fix-edition-nightly.log)

I'm creating this issue so we can track progress, and also to have a place with the logs to point at.

Maybe we incrementally upgrade crates one at a time, done by their owners, instead of trying to do the whole monorepo at once?
comments:
I tried upgrading `solana-perf` to edition 2024 and the first obstacle was that `Rng::gen` conflicts with the new Rust keyword `gen`, so `cargo fix` slapped a lot of changes like

```diff
diff --git a/perf/benches/dedup.rs b/perf/benches/dedup.rs
index 4fbdbd4dfd..ee61c6c123 100644
--- a/perf/benches/dedup.rs
+++ b/perf/benches/dedup.rs
@@ -18,7 +18,7 @@ const NUM: usize = 4096;
 fn test_packet_with_size(size: usize, rng: &mut ThreadRng) -> Vec<u8> {
     // subtract 8 bytes because the length will get serialized as well
     (0..size.checked_sub(8).unwrap())
-        .map(|_| rng.gen())
+        .map(|_| rng.r#gen())
         .collect()
 }
```

I figured that it was fixed upstream by renaming `Rng::gen` to `Rng::random` https://github.com/rust-random/rand/pull/1438, but [after trying to upgrade it](https://github.com/vadorovsky/agave/tree/update-rand), the curve-dalek crates are not happy:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `rand::rngs::OsRng: CryptoRngCore` is not satisfied
   --> zk-sdk/src/sigma_proofs/zero_ciphertext.rs:80:36
    |
80  |         let mut y = Scalar::random(&mut OsRng);
    |                     -------------- ^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `aes_gcm_siv::aead::rand_core::RngCore` is not implemented for `rand::rngs::OsRng`
    |                     |
    |                     required by a bound introduced by this call
    |
note: there are multiple different versions of crate `rand_core` in the dependency graph
   --> /root/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-1949cf8c6b5b557f/rand_core-0.6.4/src/lib.rs:142:1
    |
142 | pub trait RngCore {
    | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ this is the required trait
    |
   ::: zk-sdk/src/encryption/auth_encryption.rs:12:5
    |
12  |     aes_gcm_siv::{
    |     ----------- one version of crate `rand_core` used here, as a dependency of crate `crypto_common`
...
17  |     rand::{rngs::OsRng, Rng},
    |     ---- one version of crate `rand_core` used here, as a dependency of crate `rand`
```

There is a huge chance that's not the only crate suffering from this problem. I think we need to check whether all the crates we depend on, and depend on `rand` as well, did an upgrade. If not, we need to propose it.

I have looked at crate `bloom` and its affected by the gen conflict, which seem to not be present in rand v0.9

Not sure whats the best solution here, but i have something like this.. wdyt?

https://github.com/anza-xyz/agave/compare/master...puhtaytow:agave:feat/bloom-to-2024-1?expand=1

issueDTO.title: Unable to Switch Tabs When App Is Opened for the First Time – Customer App
issueDTO.description:
Describe the bug
When the customer app is opened for the first time after installation or cache clear, the user is unable to switch between bottom navigation tabs (e.g., Home, Orders, Cart, Profile). Tapping the tabs does not trigger any navigation until the app is restarted or reloaded.

To Reproduce

- Install or clear the cache of the customer app
- 
- Launch the app
- 
- Attempt to switch between tabs in the bottom navigation bar
- 
- Observe that the app does not respond to tab clicks initially

Expected behavior
All bottom navigation tabs should be fully functional upon first app launch without requiring a restart or reload.

Screenshots

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/19c46125-3ab1-44ca-9a85-98d7a91512e3

Smartphone (please complete the following information):

Device: Samsung A15

OS: Android 14

App Version: [insert if known]

Additional context
This may be caused by uninitialized state, delayed rendering, or missing navigation handlers during first-load lifecycle. It impacts initial user experience and should be addressed to ensure smooth onboarding.

repository.description: Enatega is a fully realized and customizable food delivery application that can be used to set up your own order/delivery management system. For more information, visit the Enatega product page: 🚀🛒📦🌐
repository.name: food-delivery-multivendor

summary.main: When the customer app is opened for the first time after installation or cache clear, the user is unable to switch between bottom navigation tabs (e.g., Home, Orders, Cart, Profile). Tapping the tabs does not trigger any navigation until the app is restarted or reloaded.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for all bottom navigation tabs to be fully functional upon first app launch without requiring a restart or reload. This ensures a smooth onboarding experience for users and addresses the initial user experience impact.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by investigating uninitialized state, delayed rendering, or missing navigation handlers during the first-load lifecycle. This may require debugging and testing to identify the root cause and implement a solution that ensures smooth onboarding for the customer app.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'bug', 'Enatega Multivendor Customer App', and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with before/after screenshots or video if possible.

issueDTO.title: Allow ctrl(cmd)+click to open URLs
issueDTO.description:
### I have checked the following:

- [x] I've searched existing issues and found nothing related to my issue.

### This feature

- [ ] blocks me from using Bruno
- [x] would improve my quality of life in Bruno

### Describe the feature you want to add, and how it would change your usage of Bruno

Bruno on MacOS is not allowing to Cmd + click to open a URL in my default browser. If I get a URL in a response and want to load that, I have to select the entire URL string and copy-paste into my browser, which is a bit inefficient.

Any chance this can be implemented?

Thanks :)

_No response_

issueDTO.title: Request: AppImage
issueDTO.description:
### Brand Name

AppImage

### Website

https://appimage.org/

### Popularity Metric

The official repository on GitHub has 8.6k stars: https://github.com/AppImage/AppImageKit

### Official Resources for Icon and Color

SVG: https://docs.appimage.org/_images/appimage.svg

### Additional Comments

AppImage is an open-source format for distributing portable software on Linux.

It is very handy for developers to distribute their software across different Linux distributions.  
Having its icon would make it easier to use shields.io icons more frequently in the README files of projects that use AppImage.
comments: Closing as this project is no longer in active development, with no [commits](https://github.com/AppImage/AppImageKit/graphs/commit-activity) since November.
Is this issue is still on? I want to contribute

@PeterShaggyNoble I don't really think the existing grading system can be particularly applied to AppImage. It is more of a standard of technology than it is an identifiable brand. But it is still very popular: Many top open source software provide AppImage builds.

GitHub Topic with 465 repos: https://github.com/topics/appimage
Official (crowdsourced) list of 1457 AppImages: https://appimage.github.io/apps/

Even then these lists are very much non-exhaustive, since anyone can use the AppImage spec/tooling to build their own AppImage without necessarily advertising it anywhere—it is a free, unencumbered system and inclusion in the AppImage list or tagging on GitHub is entirely optional. Like how anyone can make a Docker image without publishing it to the Docker Hub.

Another metric could be the interaction with the [`appimage.github.io` repo](https://github.com/AppImage/appimage.github.io/), where users can submit PRs to include AppImages in the list.

Google trends:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aa9182f0-3ecf-4a56-adc4-618a25fe6dab)

Will this do?
Yep, that certainly looks good enough to me, @prem-k-r 👍🏻

issueDTO.title: 🚨 Small Bug: Copy-pasting into app sometimes lets you maintain line breaks
issueDTO.description:
### Version Used

v14.0.0

### Expected Behavior

Line breaks should be removed when pasting into the task name, to keep consistency with how the app deals with it in other areas.

### Current Behavior

When adding a new task, line breaks are filtered out correctly immediately after pasting. However, when editing the name of the task, sometimes the app lets you keep the line break on it.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6d4a8beb-35d4-4f34-8042-5e5e31deeaaa

This example was a simplification of the issue, but some apps / sites add a invisible line break after the copied text, so this issue might appear more often.

(TBH it doesn't seem like this is a deal breaker, but I can imagine this having some potential issues if any other area of the app is not expecting line breaks at all on this field, so I am creating this issue just in case).

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open any Note-taking app to test this out
2. Write any sentence in two lines, with an Enter line-break. Example:

```
this is 
a test
```

3. Copy this text
4. Add a new task in Super Productivity
5. Paste the text on the name field of the task, and save (pressing Enter or clicking away from the task field)
You will notice that the line breaks got stripped down and the text is in a single line
7. Select the name field of the task again, and paste the text again on it.
You _should_ notice that the text is now in multiple lines.

### Can you reproduce this reliably?

Yes, I can reproduce it reliably.

### Console Output

```shell

```

issueDTO.title: Ensure Partition Specs can only contain primitive types
issueDTO.description:
Following the discussion here: https://github.com/apache/iceberg-rust/pull/349#discussion_r1855682480 and the [spec](https://iceberg.apache.org/spec/#partitioning), partitions must only produce primitive types.

This is currently not guranteed, neither by deserialization nor for `add_unbound_field`. At least adding a `void` transform can result in complex types.
comments: Instead of ensuring primitive types only, should we add check in `Transform`, e.g. check each transform supports targeting type?

I have published a pull request, which removes an if check. Now the code validates that the source column type is Primitive for all transforms including Void:
https://github.com/apache/iceberg-rust/pull/1285

@c-thiel since you authored the original code, let me know if this if check should be kept:
https://github.com/apache/iceberg-rust/blob/main/crates/iceberg/src/spec/partition.rs#L582

This is my first pull request to iceberg-rust, looking for feedback!

There is a reason for skipping check for void transform: https://github.com/apache/iceberg/blob/3469cf30f2d839763813596e3f0c66ed16189c9a/api/src/main/java/org/apache/iceberg/PartitionSpec.java#L632-L636

repository.description: Apache Iceberg
repository.name: iceberg-rust

summary.main: The issue is that the Partition Specs in the code do not ensure that they can only contain primitive types, which is a requirement specified in the Apache Iceberg spec and discussed in a pull request.
summary.validationOrRequirement: According to the discussion and the spec, partitions must only produce primitive types, and the current code does not guarantee this.
summary.attemptedFixes: A pull request has been published, which removes an if check and validates that the source column type is Primitive for all transforms including Void. The fix is available at https://github.com/apache/iceberg-rust/pull/1285.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is labeled as 'good first issue', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle.

  * Fetch all logs
  * Filter logs by `userId`, `action`, or `date`
* Add Swagger documentation (or similar) for the Admin API.
