issueDTO.title: [BUG] Fix nozzle cooling parameter
issueDTO.description:
### Printer model

32b Buddy

### Firmware version

6.3.2

### Upgrades and modifications

_No response_

### Printing from...

any

### Describe the bug

M109 detects parameter 'F' for fast nozzle cooling but it should be 'C' not to conflict with Marlin's autotemp flag.

Just replace
`(void)thermalManager.wait_for_hotend(target_extruder, no_wait_for_cooling, parser.seen('F'));`
with
`(void)thermalManager.wait_for_hotend(target_extruder, no_wait_for_cooling, parser.seen('C'));`

Introduced in #4014 but stuck in time.

### How to reproduce

```
M107
M104 S100
M109 R100
M104 S50
M109 R50 C
```

### Expected behavior

Fan should turn on (and off after reaching the final temperature).

### Files

_No response_
comments: Hello, none of our printers have AUTOTEMP enabled, so I'd say this is purely cosmetical. Is this flag emitted by the Slicer? Because if it is, when we cannot just change it.

It's safer to avoid collision. However, Prusa Slicer does not use it so it's a trivial and cosmetical change. Unfortunatelly, it's so simple that nobody cares :-(. But it would be hard once it will be used widely.

Thank you for your contribution to our project. This issue has not received any updates for 60 days and may be considered "stale." If this issue is still important to you, please add an update within the next 7 days to keep it open. Administrators can manually reopen the issue if necessary.

repository.description: Firmware for the Original Prusa MINI, Original Prusa MK4, Original Prusa XL and Prusa CORE One 3D printers by Prusa Research.
repository.name: Prusa-Firmware-Buddy

summary.main: The nozzle cooling parameter in the M109 command is currently set to 'F' instead of 'C', which can cause conflicts with Marlin's autotemp flag. This issue affects the 32b Buddy printer with firmware version 6.3.2.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the fan to turn on (and off after reaching the final temperature) when using the M109 command with the correct parameter 'C' for nozzle cooling.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by replacing `(void)thermalManager.wait_for_hotend(target_extruder, no_wait_for_cooling, parser.seen('F'));` with `(void)thermalManager.wait_for_hotend(target_extruder, no_wait_for_cooling, parser.seen('C'));` in the firmware code.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'bug', 'stale-issue', and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. However, one of the comments suggests that the issue may be considered 'cosmetical' and not a priority. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with the proposed fix.

issueDTO.title: `Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.azure.com/"` fails when signed in using the `-AccessToken` parameter.
issueDTO.description:
### Description

If users sign in using:

```pwsh
Connect-AzAccount -AccessToken
```
then running the following command:
```pwsh
Get-AzAcessToken -ResourceUrl "https//management.azure.com/"
```
will fail with the error:
```pwsh
Get-AzAccessToken: [AccessTokenAuthenticator] failed to retrieve access token for resource 'https://management.azure.com/';. Please ensure that you have provided the appropriate access tokens when using access token login.
```
However, `Get-AzAcessToken -ResourceUrl "https//management.core.windows.net/"` does work.

Also, if users authenticate using any other method (e.g., interactive, device code) without specifying `-AccessToken`, then both of the following succeed:

```pwsh
Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.azure.com/"
Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.core.windows.net/"
```

The issue seems to be related to https://github.com/Azure/azure-powershell/issues/13527.

Could this be an edge case that the `Connect-AzAccount` cmdlet fail to handle?


### Issue script & Debug output

```PowerShell
Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.azure.com/" -Debug
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [DisplaySecretsWarning], Module = [], Cmdlet = []. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - GetAzureRmAccessTokenCommand begin processing with ParameterSet 'ResourceUrl'.
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - using account id 'shenglol'...
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [DisplayBreakingChangeWarning], Module = [Az.Accounts], Cmdlet = [Get-AzAccessToken]. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [DisableInstanceDiscovery], Module = [], Cmdlet = []. Returning default value [False].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [EnableErrorRecordsPersistence], Module = [Az.Accounts], Cmdlet = [Get-AzAccessToken]. Returning default value [False].
Get-AzAccessToken: [AccessTokenAuthenticator] failed to retrieve access token for resource 'https://management.azure.com/';. Please ensure that you have provided the appropriate access tokens when using access token login.
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [DisplayBreakingChangeWarning], Module = [Az.Accounts], Cmdlet = [Get-AzAccessToken]. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [DisplayRegionIdentified], Module = [], Cmdlet = []. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [CheckForUpgrade], Module = [], Cmdlet = []. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: AzureQoSEvent:  Module: Az.Accounts:5.1.0; CommandName: Get-AzAccessToken; PSVersion: 7.5.1; IsSuccess: False; Duration: 00:00:00.0081732; SanitizeDuration: 00:00:00; Exception: [AccessTokenAuthenticator] failed to retrieve access token for resource 'https://management.azure.com/';. Please ensure that you have provided the appropriate access tokens when using access token login.;
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - [ConfigManager] Got nothing from [EnableDataCollection], Module = [], Cmdlet = []. Returning default value [True].
DEBUG: 5:13:37 PM - GetAzureRmAccessTokenCommand end processing.
```

### Environment data

```PowerShell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.5.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.5.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.22621
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

### Module versions

```PowerShell
ModuleType Version    PreRelease Name                                ExportedCommands
---------- -------    ---------- ----                                ----------------
Script     5.1.0                 Az.Accounts                         {Add-AzEnvironment, Clear-AzConfig, Clear-AzContext, Clear-AzDefault…}
```

### Error output

```PowerShell
Get-AzAccessToken: [AccessTokenAuthenticator] failed to retrieve access token for resource 'https://management.azure.com/';. Please ensure that you have provided the appropriate access tokens when using access token login.
```
comments:
Here are some similar issues that might help you. Please check if they can solve your problem.
- #13527
------------

**Possible solution (Extracted from existing issue, might be incorrect; please verify carefully)**

### Solution 1:
Please use `Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.core.windows.net/"`, current version doesn't support URL alias yet, it only respects URL from (Get-AzEnvironment).ActiveDirectoryServiceEndpointResourceId, we may do some enhancement later.

**Reference**:
- https://github.com/azure/azure-powershell/issues/13527#issuecomment-729460201
### Solution 2:
"management.core.windows.net" worked, thanks.

**Reference**:
- https://github.com/azure/azure-powershell/issues/13527#issuecomment-729981637

_Powered by [issue-sentinel](https://github.com/Azure/issue-Sentinel)_

The cmdlet first looks up the actual resource URI according to the passed-in URI, the use it to obtain a token.

In the cases of signing in interactively, since there's a refresh token in the cache, no matter which URI is provided it can always obtain an access token silently.

However, when signing in with `-AccessToken`, there's no refresh token, meaning that unless the provided URI is an exact match, it cannot acquire a new token.

This behavior is by design, but we definitely should guide customers to use `-ResourceTypeName` for well-known resources, cause it provides superior accessiblity.

For example

Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceTypeName Arm

For context, we don’t call `Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl` directly - it’s invoked by the .NET SDK (see code [here](https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-net/blob/9822a2b5ebb5ad519cad23e58dadaec0269c88d2/sdk/identity/Azure.Identity/src/Credentials/AzurePowerShellCredential.cs#L258)), so we can’t specify `-ResourceTypeName` ourselves.

repository.description: Microsoft Azure PowerShell
repository.name: azure-powershell

summary.main: The Get-AzAccessToken cmdlet fails when signed in using the -AccessToken parameter and attempting to retrieve an access token for the resource URI 'https://management.azure.com/'. The issue seems to be related to the cmdlet's handling of resource URIs and refresh tokens.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the Get-AzAccessToken cmdlet to retrieve an access token for the specified resource URI, regardless of whether it's signed in interactively or using the -AccessToken parameter.
summary.attemptedFixes: The possible solution is to use Get-AzAccessToken -ResourceUrl "https://management.core.windows.net/", current version doesn't support URL alias yet, it only respects URL from (Get-AzEnvironment).ActiveDirectoryServiceEndpointResourceId, we may do some enhancement later.
summary.otherNotes: The issue seems to be related to https://github.com/Azure/azure-powershell/issues/13527. The cmdlet first looks up the actual resource URI according to the passed-in URI, then uses it to obtain a token. However, when signing in with -AccessToken, there's no refresh token, meaning that unless the provided URI is an exact match, it cannot acquire a new token.

issueDTO.title: Generated code for client produces warning under Scala 3.7.x
issueDTO.description: The generated code for client contains implicits passed explicitly which now requires the `using` keyword from Scala 3.7.0 or a warning is triggered. Unfortunately we can't just add that because then the code will not compile under older Scala versions. It seems we need something like the `scala3_sources` in ScalaPB. See similar workaround: https://github.com/scalapb/ScalaPB/pull/1854

repository.description: Functional GraphQL library for Scala
repository.name: caliban

summary.main: The generated code for the client contains implicits passed explicitly, which triggers a warning under Scala 3.7.0. This issue needs to be fixed so that the code compiles correctly under older Scala versions.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The generated code for the client should not produce a warning under Scala 3.7.x, and the fix should be compatible with older Scala versions.
summary.attemptedFixes: The workaround involves something like the `scala3_sources` in ScalaPB, similar to the workaround found in https://github.com/scalapb/ScalaPB/pull/1854.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'client', 'good first issue', and 'tools', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle.

issueDTO.title: Add release notes into the extension
issueDTO.description:
### Proposal Summary

Should only happen for existing users, not new ones

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bce6e734-0015-4df0-8ba2-9f8e450c3a59)

### Additional context

_No response_
comments: We removed this on purpose to declutter the UI. @lifesized what is your opinion on this?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/356f68f4-a8d0-4701-a1a0-192076a9e190)
Do you mean this? If yes, then absolutely:)

> Do you mean this? If yes, then absolutely:) 

It's about the announcement with release notes

Head slap. Yes, a release version like this would be great! I think this is a good approach and looks like what Cline do.   

(If we are making new releases frequently it might be good to check with the community if we need to implement this is a less invasive way, for instance a smaller link in an alert like the example below by Curosr that then opens the release details on our website and social sites.)
Cursor: 
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2c3867e7-a019-4126-b186-0b2a18f90e69)
Cline:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b3841d2a-a712-4c65-8357-87e4a779e09a)

@catrielmuller If you don't have time to work on this can I get it assigned to me as my first issue for kilo? I need to get my feet wet with some low hanging fruit.

Thanks.

Hi @adamhill, Thank you for your interest.
This issue it's blocked because we need define what will be the origin of the alerts and how this will be show up to the users, Let me try to unblock this tomorrow and I will release the task.
No hurry. It's the 4th of July weekend in the States and I will be out with the family Thurs thru Monday.

summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'good first issue', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with a clear explanation of the changes made to add release notes into the extension.

issueDTO.title: `icon` parameters should accept Emoji shortcodes
issueDTO.description:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [x] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

We have a lot of `icon` parameters throughout our codebase. They accept emojis and Material icons, but not emoji shortcodes such as `:warning:`. We should enable that. 

### Why?

In some cases it can be more convenient to pass the shortcode instead of putting the actual emoji into your code. 

### How?

_No response_

### Additional Context

_No response_
comments:
**To help Streamlit prioritize this feature, react with a 👍 (thumbs up emoji) to the initial post.**

Your vote helps us identify which enhancements matter most to our users.

![Views](https://api.views-badge.org/badge/st-issue-10893)
Can I try for this issue? This is my first time contributing code to an open-source project.

@zyc140345 Yes, absolutely, I think this would be a very good issue to work on since it's pretty obvious what we want. Please make sure you have another look which elements have an `icon` parameter and need changes.
Note that this also means `:streamlit:` doesn't work for the `icon` parameter.
We should also do this for the `avatar` parameter of `st.chat_message`.

repository.description: Streamlit — A faster way to build and share data apps.
repository.name: streamlit

summary.main: The `icon` parameters in the Streamlit codebase currently do not accept emoji shortcodes, such as `:warning:`, and should be enabled to provide a more convenient way to pass icons.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the `icon` parameters to accept emoji shortcodes, allowing users to pass the shortcode instead of the actual emoji, making it more convenient in some cases.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by enabling the acceptance of emoji shortcodes for the `icon` parameters throughout the codebase, specifically in the `st.download_button`, `st.success`, `st.set_page_config`, `st.error`, `st.form_submit_button`, `st.info`, `st.chat_message`, `st.link_button`, `st.button`, `st.badge`, `st.warning`, and `st.multipage-apps` features.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is labeled as 'enhancement', 'good first issue', and various features, indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with before/after screenshots or video if possible.

issueDTO.title: Apply rustfmt to exercises
issueDTO.description: The exercises do not conform to the current rustfmt standard, e.g. [error-handling exercise](https://google.github.io/comprehensive-rust/error-handling/exercise.html). Maybe you can discuss if adding a ci job that checks for rustfmt changes makes sense here?
comments: That makes a lot of sense! We deviate from rustfmt in examples in a few cases, just to keep them short, but the exercises should be properly formatted.

repository.description: This is the Rust course used by the Android team at Google. It provides you the material to quickly teach Rust.
repository.name: comprehensive-rust

summary.main: The exercises do not conform to the current rustfmt standard, and it is recommended to apply rustfmt to ensure consistency and adherence to the standard.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The exercises should conform to the current rustfmt standard, as demonstrated in the [error-handling exercise](https://google.github.io/comprehensive-rust/error-handling/exercise.html).
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by applying rustfmt to the exercises, ensuring they conform to the current rustfmt standard. A CI job that checks for rustfmt changes could also be added to maintain consistency.
summary.otherNotes: The issue is currently labeled as 'good first issue', indicating it's a suitable task for a contributor to tackle.

issueDTO.title: [Umbrella] unified parameter class and refactor connector creation logic
issueDTO.description:
### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)


### Search before asking

- [x] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/seatunnel/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3A%22bug%22) and found no similar issues.


### Describe the proposal

This issue has two proposal:

1. move all parameter that user can adjust to a single class, connector use `XXXSourceConfig/ XXXSourceOptions`. 
Update `EnvCommandOptions` to describe the parameters we can adjust in config `env` part.
Update `ServerConfigOptions` to describe the parameters we can adjust about `Zeta Engine` config (config in SeaTunnel.yaml). 

The benefits:
- We can easily know what parameter can be adjusted, that can help us to tune the performance.   
- When version release, we can easily know which parameter has been changed, which can break the user version upgrade, which is added in new version, So we can record this into version upgrade document (although we don't have it yet).

Move the connector creation logic from `Connector` to `ConnectorFactory`.


The benefits:
- Know the relationship between parameters. Use the `optionRule` check the config before create connector instance.
- This can be used in SeaTunnelWeb.

summary.main: The issue proposes two major changes to the Seatunnel connector architecture: unifying the parameter classes for connectors and refactoring the connector creation logic. The changes aim to simplify the code, make it more modular, and improve maintainability.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the connectors to be created using the `ConnectorFactory` class, which will simplify the code and make it more modular. The connectors should also implement the `TableSourceFactory` and `TableSinkFactory` interfaces to create connectors that can be used to read and write data.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by creating a new `ConnectorFactory` class that handles the creation of connectors. This class can be used to centralize the logic for creating connectors and make it easier to maintain. The `Connector` class can be updated to use the `ConnectorFactory` class to create connectors. Additionally, the `TableSourceFactory` and `TableSinkFactory` interfaces can be used to create connectors that implement the `createSource` and `createSink` methods.
summary.otherNotes: This issue proposes two major changes to the Seatunnel connector architecture. The first change is to unify the parameter classes for connectors, making it easier to understand and maintain the code. The second change is to refactor the connector creation logic, moving it from the `Connector` class to the `ConnectorFactory` class. This change aims to simplify the code and make it more modular. The issue has been assigned to multiple contributors, who are working on implementing the changes for various connectors. The PR for the first change has been submitted, and the contributors are working on the second change.

issueDTO.title: Use tagify SCSS file for styling of tag inputs
issueDTO.description:
### Description
We currently include the default layout of [tagify](https://github.com/yairEO/tagify/) by copying the original CSS file from the npm package [in gulp](https://github.com/openfoodfacts/openfoodfacts-server/blob/1acd2ff884e176aa2434d5527fd05f4eb7ecd717/gulpfile.ts#L136). However, the tagify package also provides a [source SCSS file](https://github.com/yairEO/tagify/blob/v4.22.2/src/tagify.scss). It would be interesting to use the SCSS file instead and adapt the styling to our new website design.

### Proposed Solution
1. Use tagifies' SCSS file as a modifiable base instead of the pre-built CSS file
1. Update the styling to match our new website design.

### Benefits
- Consistent styling with our website design.
- Easier maintenance and customization using SCSS.

### Implementation Steps
1. Create a new SCSS file, which included the tagify SCSS file.
1. Use that SCSS file instead of the CSS file in Gulp, so it's copied to `css/dist/tagify.css` during build
1. Update the styling as needed.

### Additional Notes
- Ensure compatibility with other components and styles in our project.

issueDTO.title: Borderless `st.table`
issueDTO.description:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [x] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

Allow creating a `st.table` without any border (also between cells). 

### Why?

This can be a great tool to show data in a condensed format without doing any crazy Markdown or layout hacks. E.g. something like this:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c57ce22c-b91e-4a5c-822c-efdcb3ed065c)

### How?

Add `border=True|False` (defaulting to True) to `st.table`. If set to `False`, all borders should be invisible. 

### Additional Context

_No response_

issueDTO.title: Lasso/box selection switching and usage over existing layers
issueDTO.description:
We want to update dragging and selection such that:
- Ctrl+drag's lasso selection, upon releasing Ctrl, switches to a regular box selection, and back to lasso by holding Ctrl again. It draws a straight line between the cursor position last time the lasso was removed and when it's now restored, allowing the user to also use this as a technique for drawing straight line sections of the lasso, but also just to decide to use box selection instead of lasso at any time.
- Ctrl+dragging an *object* currently drags its layer(s) but we want to make it instead always lasso select. This lets the user perform a lasso selection over an existing layer, or a box selection but releasing Ctrl as in the previous bullet point.
- Lasso selection has a bug that should be fixed: aborting the lasso selection (RMB or Esc) then creating a new lasso selection ends up erroneously extending the previously drawn lasso path because abort fails to clear the lasso data (which also wastes memory!). (#2792)
comments:
opened https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/pull/2792 to address the last issue mentioned:
> Lasso selection has a bug that should be fixed: aborting the lasso selection (RMB or Esc) then creating a new lasso selection ends up erroneously extending the previously drawn lasso path because abort fails to clear the lasso data (which also wastes memory!).

opened https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/pull/2799 to address the second issue mentioned:
> Ctrl+dragging an object currently drags its layer(s) but we want to make it instead always lasso select. This lets the user perform a lasso selection over an existing layer, or a box selection but releasing Ctrl as in the previous bullet point.

if this change is too much / isn't preferred there is an alternative simpler change: https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/pull/2798  . This one felt kind of brittle, needing to sprinkle `!lasso_select` conditions in multiple places, so it lead me to try to refactor and create the first PR.

issueDTO.title: [FEATURE REQUEST] Adding Randomized Algorithms to the Repository
issueDTO.description:
### What would you like to Propose?

Hello everyone,

Until just five days ago, our repository had very few randomized algorithms. If anyone is motivated, they can dive into the topic and implement some interesting randomized algorithms.




### Issue details

As examples, i could consider algorithms like:

- [ ] Randomized Closest Pair Algorithm

- [x] Randomized Quicksort [solved by @VibhuKhera123 #6234 ] 

- [ ] Randomized Matrix Multiplication Verification, if A* B = C

And many others...

### Additional Information


These algorithms are a bit harder to test due to their inherent randomness, but they offer a great opportunity to expand the variety of algorithms in the repository and explore different problem-solving approaches.

If you're interested, feel free to start exploring and contribute! Any contributions would be highly appreciated.

issueDTO.title: Create Mock Blockchain Services for Testing
comments:
Hi there! 👋

I’d love to work on this “TypeScript mock implementations” task so our frontend & backend teams can develop against the StarkHive contracts before deployment. Here’s my high-level plan:

1. **Interface scaffolding**  
   - Pull the exact `NFTContractInterface`, `JobContractInterface`, etc. from Issues #440 & #441.  
   - Generate TS stubs for each contract method & event signature.

2. **Mock implementations**  
   - For each contract interface, create a `MockXyzContract` class that simulates state in-memory (e.g. `Map<…>`).  
   - Implement all methods with realistic return types, incrementing IDs or toggling states as needed.  
   - Include optional IPFS-style metadata where applicable.

3. **Configurable delays & errors**  
   - Add a shared `MockConfig` where teams can set per-contract or per-method delays (in ms) and error rates.  
   - Wrap methods in a helper that injects `await sleep(config.delay)` and randomly throws when `config.errorRate > 0`.

4. **Dockerized local server**  
   - Spin up an Express (or Fastify) HTTP+JSON-RPC server exposing each mock contract under distinct endpoints (e.g. `/mock/nft/mint`).  
   - Write a `Dockerfile` that installs dependencies, builds TS, and starts the mock server.  
   - Expose ports & volume-mount docs for easy local use.

5. **Documentation & examples**  
   - Add a `README.md` with:
     - Installation via `docker build` + `docker run`
     - Environment variables or JSON config format
     - Sample TS code showing how to `import { MockNFTContract }` or call the Docker-based RPC.  
   - Provide a small `example/` folder with a Next.js or Node script that mints a token, polls for events, and demonstrates error injection.

6. **Testing**  
   - Write unit tests (Jest) to assert that each mock follows its interface and respects delays/errors.  
   - Add a CI step in `mock/` that runs these tests.

I’ll follow the project’s CONTRIBUTING guidelines, commit under a branch named `mock-contracts-setup`, and open a draft PR once I’ve scaffolded the first two mocks. Please assign this issue to me or let me know if there’s any other setup I should follow first. Looking forward to making contract-driven dev a breeze! 🚀

issueDTO.title: Upgrade package graphql_flutter from 5.2.0-beta.8 to 5.2.0
issueDTO.description:
## Rationale
1. This was previously attempted by the automated dependabot job but the PR tests failed.
1. This issue has been created to fix the issue as there may be multiple dependency requirements that need updating
1. If this is a major revision upgrade, then many files may need to be updated to the new syntax, in their functions, methods and classes.
1. Other dependencies may need to be upgraded too

issueDTO.title: Fifo limit doesn't consider blob disk usage for key-value separated trees
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
The `Fifo` compaction strategy does not consider the size of the blob storage for key-value separated trees. I think the bug is in [this](https://github.com/fjall-rs/lsm-tree/blob/main/src/compaction/fifo.rs#L72) line. It is calling `levels.size()`, but that doesn't include the size of the blobs. We can see [here](https://github.com/fjall-rs/lsm-tree/blob/main/src/blob_tree/mod.rs#L562) that the `BlobTree::disk_usage()` considers both the size of the index (keys) & blobs (values).

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. In the [rolling-log](https://github.com/fjall-rs/fjall/blob/main/examples/rolling-log/src/main.rs) example, enable kv separation & change inserted value to `[0; 1024]`
2. Run the example & watch it crash on the assert after 5 steps.

**Expected behavior**
The partition should be compacted as per the docs.

**Additional context**
I'm using fjall, not this crate directly. But since `Fifo` is defined in this crate, I'm opening this issue here.
comments:
Key value separation avoids rewriting large amounts of data when compacting over and over again, but the FIFO compaction does not really rewrite data as long as your incoming stream is a monotonic series (key is only ascending or descending).
So there's no real advantage to using key value separation with FIFO. Should maybe be documented.

Thanks, makes sense then. Our workload is indeed just storing a stream of data where the key is just a strictly monotonically increasing sequence number: https://github.com/blacksky-algorithms/rsky/pull/119/commits/ea41de09908bb8852e178ca97a8aab5f0e3857c3.
Feel free to close the issue.

summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the FIFO compaction strategy to consider the size of the blob storage for key-value separated trees, as per the documentation.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by documenting the limitations of using key-value separation with FIFO compaction, and possibly adjusting the documentation to reflect the correct behavior.

issueDTO.title: Download videos from google search
issueDTO.description:
<!--

######################################################################
  WARNING!
  IGNORING THE FOLLOWING TEMPLATE WILL RESULT IN ISSUE CLOSED AS INCOMPLETE
######################################################################

-->


## Checklist

<!--
Carefully read and work through this check list in order to prevent the most common mistakes and misuse of youtube-dl:
- First of, make sure you are using the latest version of youtube-dl. Run `youtube-dl --version` and ensure your version is 2021.12.17. If it's not, see https://yt-dl.org/update on how to update. Issues with outdated version will be REJECTED.
- Search the bugtracker for similar site feature requests: http://yt-dl.org/search-issues. DO NOT post duplicates.
- Finally, put x into all relevant boxes (like this [x])
-->

- [x] I'm reporting a site feature request
- [x] I've verified that I'm running youtube-dl version **2021.12.17**
- [x] I've searched the bugtracker for similar site feature requests including closed ones


## Description

<!--
Provide an explanation of your site feature request in an arbitrary form. Please make sure the description is worded well enough to be understood, see https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl#is-the-description-of-the-issue-itself-sufficient. Provide any additional information, suggested solution and as much context and examples as possible.
-->

With the latest google search versions, one can look up "NFL" (for example), and the schedules, players and teams pop-up as well as (and this is what I'm suggesting to implement) previews or highlights. When trying to download them from the Google page, it does not recognizes it, the user needs to get into the actual video (youtube in most cases) to get it. Implementing this would mean much faster access to videos and the users not having to navigate several layers of webpages to download them.
I tried creating a general "google extractor" but couldn't manage to do it. Other option I thought about but could not put into practice was to handle that webpage forwarding (google search -> youtube) within the program
comments:
You'll need to open the search page with JS disabled to see anything like what yt-dl would see. With any luck, the video page will be the value of a parameter, eg `q`, in the link in the search page.

Some examples of search pages, video links in the pages and the linked videos could help this along.
There is already a google search extractor. It is broken atm, but easy to fix. See https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp/commit/c533c89ce1d6965d8575413738d76a5bf9e2de59

Thanks.

First see https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl/issues/29724 and the issue linked from it, and the manual, especially the section linked from there.

From the [comment](https://github.com/ytdl-org/youtube-dl/issues/30576#issuecomment-1026427016), possibly the linked fork has fixed the extractor and you will just need to back-port the change.

Once you have a branch working in your fork, you can make a Pull Request against the yt-dl repo.
how do i back-port the change ? I just search what it mean, should it mean that i should Copy paste the commit and make the PR myself ?
i make a fork myself so I doing to work like that (use the commit of @pukkandan )

One way is to use a tool like [_meld_](https://opensource.com/article/20/3/meld), a graphical difference editor. Check out yt-dl and yt-dlp, load the yt-dlp extractor into the editor and load the yt-dl extractor into the right-hand pane. Then you can go through the differences and decide whether the yt-dlp change should applied directly, modified or ignored. Some changes will be specific to yt-dlp and need to be adapted so as to run on both Python 2 and 3. For example, the linked commit includes these lines that will fail in Python 2 
```
                'http://www.google.com/search', f'gvsearch:{query}',
                note=f'Downloading result page {pagenum + 1}',
```
You'll need to change this in some way, say:
```
                'http://www.google.com/search', 'gvsearch:' + query,
                note='Downloading result page %d' % (pagenum + 1, ),
```

Some IDE plug-in or judicious use of _vi_ and _diff_ could achieve the same result.

If there is a specific change, a commit or set of commits, that should be applied, you can use _git_ magic to apply such commits while preserving the commit details. In GH you can add `.patch` to commit and PR URLs to generate a patch file that you can pass to the `git am` command: to make the patch applicable you first have to edit it to replace the `yt_dlp/` in pathnames with `youtube_dl/`. After applying the patch to your branch you can make any additional changes in your own subsequent commit. Eventually when this gets merged we would probably `squash` the commits in the PR so that the resulting commit appears as `Co-authored by:` all the people whose commits are included.

As above, test the modified extractor in your patch branch (there's a small test in the linked commit). Then push the branch to your yt-dl fork. You should be able to enable the server-side tests that ensure your changes work in a variety of supported environments. Fix any issues and then create a PR against our youtube_dl repo.
Hey,Can I work on this issue
Please do.
Can I work on this issue if no one's on it? @dirkf
Sure. Possibly the "AI"-ification of G search and/or the requirement to have JS for G search now makes this impractical. Let us know.

issueDTO.title: Delegations Dashboard
issueDTO.description:
This suggestion came from WiiMee:

There are several services used for "wallet delegations", such as Delegate.xyz and Warm.xyz. It would be useful to have a "Delegations" tab next to Approvals and Signatures which displays a list of delegations for a wallet with the option to revoke the delegations.

I don't know enough about how these delegations work in particular to know how viable this is, but I think it is definitely a good idea to explore it.
comments:
Delegate.xyz v1 has contract view functions that return lists of given delegations (cold -> hot wallet):
https://etherscan.io/address/0x00000000000076a84fef008cdabe6409d2fe638b#readContract

Delegate.xyz v2 has view functions that return lists of given and received delegations (cold <> hot wallet):
https://etherscan.io/address/0x00000000000000447e69651d841bd8d104bed493#readContract

Warm.xyz has view functions that return a single given delegation or a list of received delegations (cold <> hot wallet):
https://etherscan.io/address/0xc3aa9bc72bd623168860a1e5c6a4530d3d80456c#readProxyContract

So it looks like we can definitely display *given* delegations for all of these platforms with just a few smart contract calls. We should also be able to display *received* delegations for Delegate v2 and Warm easily, but not for Delegate v1. From a security perspective, inspecting / revoking *given* delegations is the important part in any case.

If we wanted full support for given + received delegations and/or if we wanted to display delegations/revokals in a future "History" tab, then we may need to look at Delegation events as well.

My idea around implementation for this would be that we create a "DelegationsPlatform" class similar to the "Chain" class, which can be instantiated with a "name" and a "getter" function. Alternatively we could also create it in a way that looks closer to the PriceStrategy, where each platform gets its own subclass.
Assigning this to @Dozie2001
Tackling this
maybe close this @rkalis  ?

issueDTO.title: [Bug]: extensions.sh fails when no passed function hooks found
issueDTO.description:
### What happened?

Recent run of `Build All Artifacts` action [failed](https://github.com/armbian/os/actions/runs/15516597014/attempts/1) at the `Prepare Info JSON and Matrices` step, due to a subshell error 123 while running the `extensions.sh` script:

```
  [💥] Error  123 occurred in SUBSHELL [ SUBSHELL at /home/actions-runner-01/_work/os/os/build/lib/functions/general/extensions.sh:582 ]
  Error:  Error  123 occurred in SUBSHELL SUBSHELL at /home/actions-runner-01/_work/os/os/build/lib/functions/general/extensions.sh:582
```

From what I can see, xargs fails due to grep returning nothing. Not sure why, perhaps there are no passed arguments so there's no `searched_hook_names` to grep?

 https://github.com/armbian/build/blob/c2d1479fa646ad42718d685527beb8815f5498c8/lib/functions/general/extensions.sh#L582

The function is new and was introduced last week:
https://github.com/armbian/build/commit/10570df8048919d15f09ef24b088b3a168793c72

Possible mitigation step is appending ` || true` to the subshell invocation at line 582 so it never fails. If lack of input arguments is indeed the issue, early `enable_extensions_with_hostdeps_builtin_and_user` return is preferable, of course.

### How to reproduce?

https://github.com/armbian/os/actions/runs/15516597014/job/43684884037#annotation:10:80

### Branch

main (main development branch)

### On which host OS are you running the build script and observing this problem?

Ubuntu 24.04 Noble

### Are you building on Windows WSL2?

- [ ] Yes, my Ubuntu/Debian/OtherOS is running on WSL2

### Relevant log URL

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

summary.main: The `extensions.sh` script fails when no passed function hooks are found, resulting in a subshell error 123 at line 582. The issue was encountered during a recent run of the `Build All Artifacts` action, specifically at the `Prepare Info JSON and Matrices` step.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the `extensions.sh` script to function correctly without errors when no passed function hooks are found. The script should handle the absence of input arguments and not fail with a subshell error.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by appending ` || true` to the subshell invocation at line 582 of the `extensions.sh` script, or by early returning `enable_extensions_with_hostdeps_builtin_and_user` if lack of input arguments is indeed the issue. Turning relative URLs into absolute URLs could also address the issue.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is labeled as 'bug' and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. The contributor is advised to submit a pull request targeting the main branch with relevant information and steps to reproduce the issue. The issue also has a Jira ticket [AR-2698](https://armbian.atlassian.net/browse/AR-2698) associated with it.

apps/mobile project in React native typescript

issueDTO.title: Better type hints
issueDTO.description:
With @pariterre, we think that we should migrate to global type hints:

currently we have such hints:
```python3
def function(entry: list[int] | tuple[int]):
      return None
```

Instead, we would like:
```python3
ListLikeInt = list[int] | tuple[int]
def function(entry: ListLikeInt):
      return None
```

Hi,

(For the ongoing hackathon :))

What do you mean by "The encoding part should be done by a new library, refactored out of lightwood.".

Best,
Dipti

Hi @f2010126,

Apologies, but I'll be working on this one -partially- to understand better that last question ourselves:

> The encoding part should be done by a new library, refactored out of lightwood.

We want to enable better feature engineering for other ML engines, too, and we think it's feasible to move this component out of lightwood. A prime first use case is for a simple (non-automl) sklearn engine to use it for any non-numerical feature, hence improving its robustness.

Also just FYI, there is an ongoing PR by another community member for auto-sklearn that we hope will be completed soon.

Hi @paxcema,

No issues :) . It would be really cool if you could publish the results of your quest for better feature engineering. The use of ML in large scale applications is a personal interest.

issueDTO.title: New common getExampleAlerts() method
issueDTO.description:
This is for all scan rules - active, passive, http, websocket, future ones :)
The method is proposed to be a 'defacto standard' for now: `List<Alert> getExampleAlerts()`

It will be accessed by the [generate_alert_pages.js](https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-admin/blob/master/scripts/generate_alert_pages.js) script using introspection. This script generates the https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/alerts/ pages.

At the moment the script can only cope with one alert per add-on, while many addons generate several.

Ease of maintenance is key - this new method should call any suitable existing methods - if they don't exist the new ones could be created.

Release & beta rules with little to no info which should implement this new method asap:

- [x] https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/alerts/10003/ Vulnerable JS Library
- [x] https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/alerts/10020/ X-Frame-Options Header
- [x] https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/alerts/10032/ Viewstate

The plan is to only expose the information currently on the alert pages, so URLs can be https://www.example.com

Any new generic text created for these alerts should be i18n'd

summary.main: This is for all scan rules - active, passive, http, websocket, future ones :). The method is proposed to be a 'defacto standard' for now: `List<Alert> getExampleAlerts()`. It will be accessed by the [generate_alert_pages.js](https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-admin/blob/master/scripts/generate_alert_pages.js) script using introspection. At the moment the script can only cope with one alert per add-on, while many addons generate several. Ease of maintenance is key - this new method should call any suitable existing methods - if they don't exist the new ones could be created. summary.main: The product editor is showing applications that are not available, resulting in an incorrect list of applications and products. This issue needs to be fixed to ensure the product editor accurately reflects the available applications and products.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the product editor to only show applications that are available and not display those that are not. The issue needs to be fixed so that the product editor accurately reflects the available applications and products.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by filtering the list of products and applications based on the available extensions from the dependencies. Alternatively, it can propose to depend on the plugin that provides the application/product. The issue can be resolved by adding an 'help' information label to explain how to find all the applications and productions available in the target platform.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with before/after screenshots or video if possible.

issueDTO.title: Github verification bug
issueDTO.description:
## Description 📹

Loom : https://www.loom.com/share/6496af3229144f6da4503eece78839b3

**There is a bug preventing me from verifying my GitHub account identity. I can restart this process in an infinite loop, and I don't know if my GitHub account is verified. There is no 'done' check icon.**

## Proposed Actions 🛠️

Here’s a checklist of actions to follow for resolving this issue:

1. **Fork and Create Branch**:  
   Fork the repository and create a new branch using the issue number:
   ```bash
   git checkout -b fix-[issue-number]
   ```

2. **Implement Changes**:  
	[Insert Code snippet if needed with a mardown todo list]

3. **Run Tests and Commit Changes**:  
   Make sure your changes don't break existing functionality and commit with a clear message:
   ```bash
   git commit -m "Fix: [Short description of the fix]"
   ```

## Required 📋

To keep our workflow smooth, please make sure you follow these guidelines:

- **Assignment**: Don't create a pull request if you weren’t assigned to this issue.
- **Timeframe**: Complete the task within **3 business days**.
- **Closing the Issue**: In your PR description, close the issue by writing `Close #[issue_id]`.
- **Review Process**:
  - Once you've submitted your PR, change the label to **"ready for review"**.
  - If changes are requested, address them and then update the label back to **"ready for review"** once done.
- **Testing**: Test your PR locally before pushing, and verify that tests and build are working after pushing.

Thank you for your contribution 🙏

⚠️ WARNING: Failure to follow the requirements above may result in being added to the OnlyDust blacklist, affecting your ability to receive future rewards.

issueDTO.title: Query on Inconsistent Session Time Display
issueDTO.description: 原因も再現性も仕様なのかもよく分からないのですがとりあえず報告させていただきます。 #### **Description** Hello, I've observed an inconsistency between the session time displayed in the Claude Code extension UI and the time shown by the `ccusage` command-line tool, and I would like to ask if this is the intended behavior. Currently, the extension UI indicates the session resets at 6 PM, which is the actual time the session ends. However, the `ccusage blocks --live` monitor in the terminal shows the session ending at a different time (8 PM in the attached screenshot). This difference can be a bit confusing as it's not clear which timer to follow. Could you please clarify if this is the expected behavior? #### **Steps to Observe the Behavior** 1. On macOS with the latest version of VS Code. 2. Have the Claude Code extension installed. 3. In the VS Code integrated terminal, run the command `ccusage@latest blocks --live`. 4. The time displayed by the extension in the editor's top bar ("resets at 6pm") differs from the "Remaining" time in the `ccusage` monitor (e.g., shows end time of 8:00:00 PM). #### **My Expectation** For clarity, I would expect both timers to be synchronized and reflect the actual session end time. #### **Screenshots** As shown in the screenshot, the top right of the IDE indicates a reset time of 6 PM, while the `ccusage` session monitor in the terminal shows a session end time of 8 PM. #### **Environment** * **OS:** macOS * **IDE:** Visual Studio Code (Latest Version) * **Tool:** `ccusage@latest` * **Extension Name & Version:** Claude Code `[Please add extension version if known]` Thank you for looking into this.
comments:

issueDTO.title: When Curse of Inertia triggers it allows the attacker to target multiple permanent instead of just one
issueDTO.description: The effect (tap or untap) is only applied to the last target selected, but it is confusing that the player is able to select multiple targets.
comments: [[Curse of Inertia]]

**[Curse of Inertia](https://cards.scryfall.io/normal/front/3/2/32d0c2a7-4277-43eb-bb09-5ca0c27edee4.jpg?1592672512)** - [(Gatherer)](https://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=430254&printed=false) [(Scryfall)](https://scryfall.com/card/cma/35/curse-of-inertia?utm_source=api) [(EDHREC)](https://edhrec.com/route/?cc=Curse+of+Inertia)
> {2}{U}
> Enchantment — Aura Curse
> Enchant player
> Whenever a player attacks enchanted player with one or more creatures, that attacking player may tap or untap target permanent of their choice.

It miss clear targets call, so adds duplicated targets on each trigger check.

Looks like there are possible other cards with same code style/bug.

Good implementation example:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/69b58a0b-34bc-400c-903a-2287fad6d607)
I'll fix this soon (in this specific case), saw it while updating #13647 for per-ability target checking. Did not do an overall check for other cards with the same bug though.

issueDTO.title: Tracking Issue: New nodes
issueDTO.description:
Status of this issue: all of this needs to be reviewed and revised. Consider this list to be more of "inspiration" than a todo list, until we can rework it in its entirety to create an actual todo list.

---

This is a living, growing list. It's not organized and isn't ready-to-grab-from— please ask in Discord if you'd like to begin adding nodes or have an interest in certain ones, since they will probably need some discussion and some may be blocked on current technical limitations. But this does list a lot of opportunities for interesting contributions.

Documentation for making new nodes: https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/blob/master/node-graph/README.md

### Noise
- [x] Pixel Noise
- [x] Perlin and/or Simplex Noise (#1517)
- [x] Voronoi Noise (#1517)

### Image Dimensions
- [ ] Crop based on margin
- [ ] Crop based on top left offset and desired dimensions
- [ ] Resize based on scale factor (user to choose interpolation method)
- [ ] Resize based on desired resolution (user to choose interpolation method)
- [ ] Tile to fill bounds
- [ ] Get image dimensions (returns vec2)

### Image transformations
- [ ] Flip (choose horizontal or vertical)
- [ ] Rotate (choose interpolation method and negative space fill)
- [ ] Shift image (choose X, Y and negative space fill)

### Image channels
- [x] #1169
- [x] Extract Alpha
- [x] Extract Opaque

### Image adjustments
- [x] Brightness/Contrast
- [x] Levels
- [ ] Curves - *requires custom widget*
- [x] Exposure
- [x] Vibrance - *still needs a Saturation slider*
- [x] Hue/Saturation - *current algorithm is incorrect*
- [ ] Color Balance
- [x] Black & White - *rename from Grayscale*
- [ ] Photo Filter
- [x] Channel Mixer
- [ ] Color Lookup
- [x] Invert RGB
- [x] Posterize
- [x] Threshold
- [x] Selective Color
- [x] Gradient Map

### Other adjustments
- [x] Gamma
- [x] Opacity
- [x] #1391 (replace all colors with chosen color, keep alpha)
- [ ] #986
- [ ] Height map to Normal map node

### Filters
- [x] #911
- [x] #995
- [ ] [Box blur](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Box_blur) (a faster, lower-quality alternative to Gaussian Blur)
- [ ] [Median](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Median_filter)
- [ ] [Sharpen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unsharp_masking)
- [ ] Dithering (various algorithms, see [this discussion](https://x.com/bbssppllvv/status/1835048028975112265))

### Vector
- [ ] Convert group containing paths to VectorData path with the shapes as subpaths
- [ ] Metaballs from points-and-radii (see: <https://medium.com/@tbarrasso/advanced-meta-metaballs-864bbf0a945c>, <https://varun.ca/metaballs/>, <https://x.com/furafuku/status/1937586455930626439>)
- [ ] Silhouette (removes all interior negative space and geometry, leaving only the outermost path; basically a boolean union operation that removes interior negative space as well)
- [ ] Convex hull
- [x] #1091
- [x] #1092
- [ ] https://github.com/GraphiteEditor/Graphite/issues/1162 Vector Edit (nondestructively apply a queue of operations from the Path tool to an existing shape)
- [ ] Polyline Subsurf
- [ ] Voronoi from Points (map a point cloud into vector shapes centered at those points forming a Voronoi diagram, with a smoothing option)
- [ ] Roughen (amplitude, frequency, absolute/relative to scale, smooth/sharp)
- [x] Spline from Polyline
- [ ] Point/Handle Groups
- [ ] Packing (support for both convex and concave)
- [x] Area
- [ ] Bounding Box (Modification)
	- [ ] -> Min (Top Left X,Y)
	- [ ] -> Max (Bottom Right X,Y)
- [ ] Read (from Blender)
	- [ ] Curve Handle Positions
	- [ ] Curve Length
	- [ ] Curve Tangent
	- [ ] Endpoint Selection
	- [ ] Handle Type Selection
	- [ ] Is Spline Cyclic
	- [ ] Spline Length
	- [ ] Spline Parameter
	- [ ] Spline Resolution
- [ ] Sample (from Blender)
	- [ ] Sample Curve
- [ ] Write (from Blender)
	- [ ] Set Curve Normal
	- [ ] Set Curve Width
	- [ ] Set Curve Radius
	- [ ] Set Handle Positions
	- [ ] Set Handle Type
	- [ ] Set Spline Cyclic
	- [ ] Set Resolution
	- [ ] Set Spline Type
- [ ] Operations (from Blender)
	- [ ] Curve to Points
	- [ ] Deform Curves on Surface
	- [ ] Fillet Curve
	- [ ] Interpolate Curves
	- [x] #1226 Resample Curves
	- [ ] Reverse Curve
	- [ ] Subdivide Curve
	- [ ] Trim Curve
- [ ] Primitives (from Blender)
	- [ ] Arc
	- [ ] Bezier Segment
	- [x] Curve Circle
	- [x] Curve Line
	- [ ] Curve Spiral (But 2D)
	- [ ] Quadratic Bezier
	- [ ] Quadrilateral [Rectangle, Parallelogram, Trapezoid, Kite, Points]
	- [x] Star
- [ ] Topology (from Blender)
	- [ ] Offset Point in Curve
	- [ ] Curve of Point
	- [ ] Points of Curve
	
### Stroke (Modification)
- [x] -> Fill Type [Solid, Gradient, Contour]
- [x] -> Custom Width Profile
- [x] -> Custom Line Join Profile
- [x] -> Custom Line Cap Profile
- [ ] -> Align[Center, Inside, Outside]
- [ ] Expand Stroke

### Contour Tool/Node
- [x] -> Radius
- [x] -> Contour Type[Round, Miter, Bevel, Custom]
- [x] -> Miter
- [x] -> Contour Cap[None, Round, Square]
- [ ] -> Contour Fill[Auto Closed, Force Open, Force Closed]
- [ ] -> Radius
- [ ] -> Contour Type[Round, Concave, Straight, Cutout, Custom]
- [ ] -> Selection

### Brush
- [x] #1069
- [ ] Texture
- [ ] Properties (per stroke?)

### Generic

- [x] Circular repeat
- [ ] Mirror
- [ ] Scatter

---

### Widgets
- [ ] Curves Widget

### Instances (from Blender)
- [x] Instance on Points (#1513)
- [ ] Instance to Points
- [ ] Realize Instances
- [ ] Rotate Instances
- [ ] Scale Instances

### Instance Points (from Blender)

### Utilities

### Maths

NOTE: All will have Clamp Option (0.,1.)

- [ ] Functions
	- [x] Add
	- [x] Subtract
	- [x] Multiply
	- [x] Divide
	- [ ] Multiply Add
	- [x] Power
	- [x] Logarithm
	- [x] Square Root
	- [x] Absolute
	- [x] Exponent
	- [x] Clamp
	- [ ] Float curve
	- [ ] Map range
- [ ] Comparison
	- [x] Min
	- [x] Max

	- [ ] Greater Than

- [ ] Rounding

	- [ ] Truncate

- [ ] Trigonometric

- [ ] Conversion
	- [ ] To Radians
	- [ ] To Degrees
- [ ] Mix
- [ ] Vec2
	- [x] multiply by scalar or vector
	- [x] divide by scalar or vector
	- [x] add
	- [x] subtract
	- [ ] length
	- [ ] length squared
	- [ ] normalise
	- [ ] distance between two vectors
	- [x] dot product
	- [ ] cross product
	- [ ] ceil (per axis)
	- [ ] floor (per axis)
	- [ ] min (per axis)

	- [ ] Linear interpolation (lerp)

### Misc (from Blender)

- [x] Switch
comments: A good resource for nodes (vulkan compute shaders) useful in photo editing can be found in [vkdt](https://github.com/hanatos/vkdt/tree/master/src/pipe/modules). Also Aurelien's [blog](https://eng.aurelienpierre.com/2021/02/image-processing-does-not-kill-people-and-its-a-shame/#do-the-right-thing-the-right-way-at-the-right-time) has quite a few gems (if you don't mind his language) @Keavon
Neat, thanks for the resources!

issueDTO.title: Dynamic feedback reminder
issueDTO.description:
The current release of Soundscape Community app features a pop-up on first opening it which invites the user to feedback on the 'vicinity distance' feature. The issue is that it appears before the user has had the opportunity to use it, and it does not make it easy for them then to provide any feedback on it. 
In addition to the Feedback option from the menu drop-down, this issue is about providing a more dynamic feedback reminder to the user. Key considerations include:
- Allowing the user to cancel the pop-up screen so they do not get the notification again (at least on the current installation!)
- Pop-up appearing after approx 5-7 sessions
- Making it easy to provide feedback, e.g. a rating scale for a particular feature, with supporting text field for additional details
comments: is this only when you first download the app because when I just opened the app on my phone i did not get that pop up? I would be willing to look into this issue I just am not sure how to view that pop up.

Thanks @MBtheOtaku I see that my initial note is not entirely clear on the behaviour!
What we're looking for is to not have the feedback pop-up appear on first use after downloading and opening the app, but to have it appear after about 5 separate sessions, and for it to have a rating scale of 1-5 stars, and an open text field for any other feedback. Hope that helps clarify...
I'm going to start working on this issue!

I started working on this issue by creating a new Helper file similar to AppShareHelper and AppReviewHelper which handle the pop-ups for sharing or reviewing the app. I was wondering what would be the best way to store user responses? Is there some sort of API to use to receive the responses? Or should I use GDATelemetry? I noticed it says it's a stub, but still seems to be used.

There's not currently any mechanism for receiving  user data. The `GDATelemetry` subsystem was not included in the open-source release provided by Microsoft, and we never hooked up a replacement, so all the references you see to it in the code are no-ops. Getting a working telemetry system would be a nice project on its own, though at the same time I'm quite happy not having us handling any user-provided data and the security/privacy implications that come with that.

As for the feature at issue here, the current feedback link just opens a new email message in the user's email program. Keeping this as the mechanism could be fine for a first pass while we're focusing on improving the UX of when/how the prompt gets shown.

issueDTO.title: fsac.cache always in obj/
issueDTO.description:
**Describe the bug**
I've recently configured my project to build all intermediate and built artifacts into `obj/` and `bin/` outside of the main `src/` folder through a  `Directory.Build.props` file. However, it seems `fsac.cache` doesn't pick this up and still creates `obj/fsac.cache` in each of the `src/project/` folders.


```
// src/Directory.Build.props
<Project>
  <PropertyGroup>
    <BaseOutputPath>../../build/$(MSBuildProjectName)/bin</BaseOutputPath>
    <BaseIntermediateOutputPath>../../build/$(MSBuildProjectName)/obj</BaseIntermediateOutputPath>
 </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```

**Expected behaviour**

To find a `build/project/obj/proj-info.cache` file.

Instead, a file appears in `src/project/obj/fsac.cache`


**Environment:**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - FsAutoComplete: 0.45.4
 - Neovim: 0.5 Nightly
 - dotnet SDK version: 5
comments: This would be part of a larger effort to make the projects in general aware of intermediate output paths. Most of the offending code seems to be [here](https://github.com/ionide/proj-info/blob/7cac2232d626f556ac55d8438eb8efdf5c7deb2a/src/Ionide.ProjInfo.ProjectSystem/Project.fs#L46-L121), where there are hard references to the bin/obj directories of the project.
I could take a stab at this but I know nothing about project cracking. Any pointers?
I've run into the same issue, also using a `Directory.Build.props` file. I could take a look at it but it will take a while to get up to speed.
Are these cache files still used? I don't see any created with the current Ionide
No I probably broke them while doing the Adaptive LSP refactoring.

repository.description: Parse and evaluate MsBuild project files
repository.name: proj-info

summary.main: The fsac.cache file is currently being created in the wrong location, obj/fsac.cache, instead of the expected build/project/obj/proj-info.cache location. This is causing issues with the project's configuration of intermediate and built artifacts.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for the fsac.cache file to be created in the build/project/obj/proj-info.cache location, rather than in the src/project/obj/fsac.cache location. The issue is affecting the project's ability to correctly configure intermediate and built artifacts.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by modifying the code in src/Ionide.ProjInfo.ProjectSystem/Project.fs, specifically lines 46-121, to use the intermediate output paths defined in the Directory.Build.props file. The user PhilT has suggested that the offending code is located in this file.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is labeled as 'enhancement' and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle. The issue is currently open and has 3 comments from users, including one suggesting a larger effort to make projects aware of intermediate output paths.

## Guideline
1. Carefully read the issue description before applying to ensure you have all the necessary information to start working on it.
2. Write a brief description of how you will approach the task (without using ChatGPT).
3. Add your Telegram handler in your application (e.g., in OnlyDust or similar)
4. Write ETA in your application



## What should I do if I have a problem
1. Try to google it before asking. Googling is taking major part of dev work 
2. If you couldn't find answer your question with Google, text your question to [dev](https://t.me/spotnet_dev/4) group with your question.
3. Do not send DM to maintainer, it would be better and faster to ask other contributors in chat 


## How to prepare PR
1. Check if your code [smell](https://refactoring.guru/refactoring/smells) good
2.  Add `close #<issue number>` to link your issue with your PR
3.  Do not commit changes which is not related to your task 
4. Check after you created PR, if you committed everything.

2. In [`docker-compose.margin.back.yml`](https://github.com/djeck1432/spotnet/blob/main/devops/docker-compose.margin.back.yml), remove the `frontend` service.

issueDTO.title: Professor Hojo - Reduction not working for equipment
issueDTO.description:
[[Professor Hojo]] should reduce costs of abilities but as it is only checked as soon as the target is selected it is not possible to activate an ability if the controller doesn't have enough mana open.
Example:
It should be possible to equip the Conformer Shuriken as it is free due to Professor Hojo

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d73af440-56c6-4690-b2c9-663429d55334)

As soon as I have 2 mana it is possibel to equip for free:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f8405709-4757-4201-b863-5a3fd3caad2f)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c4ec5260-5440-4537-9880-5240ea7cbccd)
comments:
**[Professor Hojo](https://cards.scryfall.io/normal/front/1/0/107ffe2e-47eb-43de-bc9e-c68013b62912.jpg?1748704447)** - [(Gatherer)](undefined) [(Scryfall)](https://scryfall.com/card/fic/69/professor-hojo?utm_source=api) [(EDHREC)](https://edhrec.com/route/?cc=Professor+Hojo)
> {1}{G}
> Legendary Creature — Human Scientist
> 2/2
> The first activated ability you activate during your turn that targets a creature you control costs {2} less to activate.
> Whenever one or more creatures you control become the target of an activated ability, draw a card. This ability triggers only once each turn.

It must check game.inCheckPlayableState() - if it playable calculation then look at possible targets. If it real activate then look at selected targets. CardUtil has getAllPossibleTargets method for such use cases.

issueDTO.title: Replace custom backoff with https://github.com/litl/backoff
issueDTO.description:
Remove our homemade `ExponentialBackoff` (in `helpers.py`) and switch to the proven [litl/backoff](https://github.com/litl/backoff) library. This will simplify retry logic, reduce maintenance, and leverage built-in features (jitter, logging hooks).

---

## Changes

1. **Add Dependency**

   * Add `backoff>=2.0.1` to `pyproject.toml`.

2. **Delete `ExponentialBackoff`**

   * Remove its class definition from `helpers.py`.

3. **Refactor `buffers.py`**

   * Remove `retry_backoff` and `shutdown_backoff` fields.
   * Create a private method (e.g. `_flush_once`) for a single callback attempt.
   * Decorate(?) `flush` with:

     ```python
     @backoff.on_exception(
         backoff.expo, Exception,
         max_time=10,
         on_backoff=lambda details: await asyncio.sleep(details["wait"])
     )
     async def flush(self):
         …  # call _flush_once or re-enqueue on final failure
     ```
   * Decorate(?) `shutdown_and_flush` similarly, stopping early if the queue is empty.

4. **Update Tests**

   * Replace any expectations around manual `next_delay()`/`reset()` with assertions for the `backoff` retry behavior.
   * Ensure `flush` stops retrying once the callback succeeds.
   * Verify shutdown halts when the buffer is empty or max time is reached.

5. **Documentation**

   * Remove references to “custom backoff.”
   * Note how to adjust `backoff.expo` parameters (base/jitter/max\_time) if needed.

---

## Checklist

* [ ] Add `backoff` to dependencies
* [ ] Delete `ExponentialBackoff` from `helpers.py`
* [ ] Refactor `buffers.py` to use `@backoff.on_exception`
* [ ] Update/remove imports of `ExponentialBackoff`
* [ ] Revise tests to target `litl/backoff` behavior
* [ ] Update documentation to mention `litl/backoff`

issueDTO.title: [Image] Transparent Images in Dark Mode
issueDTO.description: ### Title [Image] Transparent Images in Dark Mode ### Description In dark mode, images with transparent backgrounds may not be visible. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Go to https://p5js.org/contribute/fes_contribution_guide/ 2. Locate the Accessibility drop-down menu, select Dark Mode 3. ### Actual Behavior The transparent image is barely visible in dark mode. ### Expected Behavior Image content and background color should have a minimum of 4.5:1 contrast ratio. ### Environments Browser & Version: Chrome 138 Operating System & Version: macOS 15.1 ### Suggested Fix - Possibly update CSS to apply invert() to dark mode images - Or ensure that images on the website don't have a transparent background ### Reference [1.4.3 Contrast (Minimum) Level AA](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/contrast-minimum) ### What is your operating system? Mac OS ### Web browser and version Chrome 138

issueDTO.title: When copying and pasting an entry to another bib file - all attached files should also be copied
issueDTO.description:
As user, I have my `personal.bib` and a collaboratively edited `paper.bib` (Refs https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/160). The `paper.bib` has configured a (separate) file directory where the PDFs are stored. If this is true, I would like to have to following behavior:

1. I copy an entry of `personal.bib`. That entry has attached a PDF `A.pdf`.
2. I paste that entry to `paper.bib`.
3. `A.pdf` should be copied to the file directory of library `paper.bib`

In summary: All attached files should be copied if original files are not reachable from new library. One needs to keep the relative path structure while copying (to keep the files field unmodified)

Hi.
I'd like to give this a try. It seems like no one is actively working on it right now, so I'm happy to explore the codebase and see if I can implement the file-copy behavior as described.

I'm new to JabRef.

I tried the following structure:
.
├── paper
│   └── paper.bib
└── personal
    ├── personal.bib
    └── something.txt

personal.bib has a file field pointing to something.txt. When I copy the entry from personal.bib into paper.bib, I can still see the attachment in the GUI, but trying to open it from within paper.bib fails.

Just to confirm: In this case, the file something.txt should be copied to the paper directory so that it becomes reachable relative to paper.bib, right?

@umu directory structure a bit strange. But OK. I am one the road. Short answer: seems right. Please keep the relative path; but the file has to be copied (because the starting point changes). Read on at https://devdocs.jabref.org/code-howtos/#get-a-relative-filename-or-path-for-a-file and think of different cases. Maybe the file is reachable from the other bib file without copying; then just the path needs to be adapted.

Sorry for asking again, I just want to make sure I fully understand the intended behavior. Let’s say I have the following structure: When I copy an entry from personal.bib to parent.bib, then the file is not reachable and needs to be copied, that part is clear. But if I copy an entry from personal.bib to paper.bib, and paper.bib has @ Comment{jabref-meta: fileDirectory:paperfiles;}, the file is still reachable without copying. However, the current implementation keeps the file field as: file = {:personalfiles/something.txt:TXT} And you would like that to be changed to a relative path like: file = {:../personalfiles/something.txt:TXT} So that it works correctly from the perspective of paper.bib with its fileDirectory set to paperfiles/? Thanks again for your guidance and for your time!

issueDTO.title: [Feature Request]: Improve "completion date" visibility for non-completed torrents
issueDTO.description:
### Description

At the moment, incomplete torrents show their completion date as `1970-01-01 00:00:00`. I understand why it appears that way, but it's misleading to have that as the completion date, and hinders one's ability to parse that column.

### Describe the solution you'd like

It would be mildly easier to parse that column if instead it appeared as `N/A` or some other indicator that it is not completed.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Complementary informations

- [ ] Is this feature already implemented in the default WebUI?
comments: This issue seems to already be resolved in the latest release. Incomplete torrents show their "Completed On" value as "Never seen complete" on the dashboard and as "N/A" on the details view.
I'm on 2.22.0, I'll check out 2.23.0 and see

I upgraded to 2.23.0 and I still have the behaviour I described. The "Completed On" column displays the 1970 date, as does the info chip in the dashboard:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4152a3f2-6fb5-4934-b849-150bdc3df24d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/baf45883-f3cb-48ed-a60a-3c6c7ef8fd10)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5b370e60-382a-47fa-b60d-4c50589a6312)
Oh, this might be a qBittorrent version issue then. I tested it on qBittorrent v5.0.4 and VueTorrent v2.23.0.

In that case, I'll need the value returned by qBittorrent to better understand the real issue here.

qBittorrent did change the way they handle this field in 5.0

https://github.com/qbittorrent/qBittorrent/commit/ad22237a2f50f9a636ed39bfc3f70e32c0e439ea#diff-74790edbe4766657bffad7700b1a73f606a7692cee56f1e093c7357ecdaea915R139

Here's the [wiki link](https://github.com/VueTorrent/VueTorrent/wiki/Support#how-to-view-network-requests) for checking network requests.
Fetching this field is a bit complicated but you need to open your DevTools **before** opening VueTorrent. Then the field will be in the `maindata` request, expand the torrent hash causing the bug and send the "completion_on" field

I just tested with qBittorrent v4.6.3. It seems like the `completion_on` field is returning the date-time `1970-01-01 00:00:00` of your system timezone as seconds since Unix epoch. So if your timezone is UTC-8, `completion_on` would be 28800, 0 for UTC+0, and -3600 for UTC+1.

But the UI should display the not complete message for all "invalid" dates, that is 0 or negative values. The issue shouldn't happen the way you describe it.

What do you receive exactly as the value when it displays the 1970 date? Is it 28800 ?

I thought it was a fixed value but if you say that it depends on your time zone, I would suggest setting up your qBittorrent instance to the correct timezone.

I was testing different timezones by changing my system timezone using `timedatectl`. The UI displays `1970-01-01 00:00:00` for incomplete torrents when your timezone is west of UTC (e.g. UTC-8). I'm getting a `completed_on` value of 28800 for UTC-8. The UI correctly displays "Never seen complete" when the timezone is UTC+, for which `completed_on` has a 0 or negative value.

A possible hack is to change the condition for displaying the date-time from `val > 0` to `val > 43200` (`12 * 60 * 60`) to account for all timezones up to UTC-12

Maybe I'm not looking in the right place, but this is a `/properties` request for an in-progress torrent:
The only seemingly relevant field is the `completion_date` (3rd from the top) which is set to `-1`.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f842f0c9-3f31-412e-8d2b-90008e1982e4)

Depending on where you look, this is the same field but with different names.

---

qBit v5+:

In `serialize_torrent.cpp` (maindata):
```cpp
{KEY_TORRENT_COMPLETION_ON, Utils::DateTime::toSecsSinceEpoch(torrent.completedTime())},
```

In `torrentscontroller.cpp` (properties):
```cpp
{KEY_PROP_COMPLETION_DATE, Utils::DateTime::toSecsSinceEpoch(torrent->completedTime())},
```

Converter function:
```cpp
qint64 Utils::DateTime::toSecsSinceEpoch(const QDateTime &dateTime)
{
    return dateTime.isValid() ? dateTime.toSecsSinceEpoch() : -1;
}
```

---

qBit v4.6.7:

In `serialize_torrent.cpp` (maindata):
```cpp
{KEY_TORRENT_COMPLETION_ON, toTimeStamp(torrent.completedTime())},
```

In `torrentscontroller.cpp` (properties):
```cpp
{KEY_PROP_COMPLETION_DATE, toTimeStamp(torrent->completedTime())},
```

Converter function:
```cpp
const auto toTimeStamp = [](const QDateTime &dateTime) -> qint64
{
    return dateTime.isValid() ? dateTime.toSecsSinceEpoch() : -1;
};
```

---

Given that all of these leads to the same code, it shouldn't differ in behaviour. If we take a look at how torrents data is updated, we can see that the code is also identical.

For qBit 5+:
```cpp
if (m_nativeStatus.completed_time != oldStatus.completed_time)
  m_completedTime = (m_nativeStatus.completed_time > 0) ? QDateTime::fromSecsSinceEpoch(m_nativeStatus.completed_time) : QDateTime();
```

For qBit 4.6.7:
```cpp
QDateTime TorrentImpl::completedTime() const
{
  if (m_nativeStatus.completed_time > 0)
      return QDateTime::fromSecsSinceEpoch(m_nativeStatus.completed_time);
  else
      return {};
}
```

From [Qt docs](https://doc.qt.io/qt-6/qdatetime.html#fromSecsSinceEpoch-1:~:text=year%201970%2C%20described%20as%20specified%20by%20timeZone.-,The%20default%20time%20representation%20is%20local%20time.,-Note%20that%20there%20are%20possible%20values%20for%20secs), the default is to use the local timezone for the `fromSecsSinceEpoch` method, which confirms the bug.

I think in the end that the behaviour did not change.

@cheneyni-451 if you installed qBittorrent using docker or any other virtualization technology, changing your system timezone will not change anything. Each virtualization uses differnet method for this. The docker image may use a variable environment or a volume mount.

EDIT: Also from the [Qt docs](https://doc.qt.io/qt-6/qdatetime.html#isValid), the isValid method will return false in really rare cases. Given that the date is always initialized to a valid time (either the one defined or now with no data), it don't understand how the -1 value can be returned.

I was building my own from scratch, but ran into some issues with MCP integration. Then I found this — clean, functional, and just works.

**One suggestion:**
Would it be possible to think first, then reply a pre-message, and only after that trigger the MCP? Something like this:

User: `Show me the last 10 AI news`
Model (thinking mode): “Alright, the user is asking for tech-related news… let me check if there’s any available MCP for that… found one, now I’ll trigger it.”
Model reply user right away: Got it — here are the latest AI updates: 
[MCP call]

This kind of pre-processing — with a message before actually calling the MCP — would make the flow feel smarter and more human-like, especially for models that support thinking mode.
