issueDTO.title: [Feature Request]: Allow right-clicking to change the current selection in select mode
issueDTO.description:
### Description

When I'm in select mode, I often find myself finishing up with what I currently have selected and needing to quickly do something with some other torrent. Right-clicking on a currently non-selected torrent will make that torrent row blink as if it accepted the interaction and the right-click menu will open, but whatever thing you change will still be applied to the previously selected torrents, i.e. the right-clicked torrent will not become the new currently selected torrent.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Just like left clicking on a torrent (i.e. not directly on its checkbox) selects it, I would like that right-clicking on a non-selected torrent immediately switches the current selection to it and opens the right-click menu with that new torrent as the target.

And now that I think about it, Ctrl/Shift + right-clicking on a non-selected torrent could have the additional functionality of *adding* the new torrent and/or all the torrents in between (i.e. typical Ctrl/Shift selection behavior) to the currently selected torrent(s) and immediately opening the right-click menu with both previously *and* newly selected torrents as the target.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Complementary informations

- [ ] Is this feature already implemented in the default WebUI?
comments:
Introducing a temporary store to apply changes to single torrents while a multi-selection is active seems like a lot of code complexity added for such a small improvement. I'm afraid it will lead to bugs more than it will benefit users...

> And now that I think about it, Ctrl/Shift + right-clicking on a non-selected torrent could have the additional functionality of adding the new torrent and/or all the torrents in between (i.e. typical Ctrl/Shift selection behavior) to the currently selected torrent(s)

Not sure what you mean by that as it already works...

> Introducing a temporary store to apply changes to single torrents while a multi-selection is active seems like a lot of code complexity added for such a small improvement. I'm afraid it will lead to bugs more than it will benefit users...

That's not exactly what I meant; I meant that if I have `torrent1` currently selected, then right-clicking on `torrent2` would immediately deselect `torrent1`, select `torrent2`, and perform the right-click action on `torrent2` (i.e. open the right-click menu).

> Not sure what you mean by that as it already works...

I meant that in the context of right-clicking as described above, i.e. if we're at this state:

`torrent1` **[selected]**
`torrent2`
`torrent3`

Then:

- Ctrl+right-click `torrent3` -> select `torrent3` in addition to `torrent1`, and immediately apply the right-click action to both of them.
- Shift+right-click `torrent3` -> select `torrent3` and `torrent2` in addition to `torrent1`, and immediately apply the right-click action to all three of them.

Just to make sure I understood everything, this only applies for multi-select?

You want to be able to select a torrent on top of opening the right click menu with a single click on a torrent card. With the current behaviour kept for left-clicking (same behaviour but without the menu opening)

Again, sorry for the very late reply.

Yes, that's exactly it. Left-click behavior is just fine; right-click behavior should be equivalent to select + immediate right click action, i.e. open the menu with a target of all currently selected torrents.

So for example, if I want to perform a right-click action on three torrents A, B and C:

1. Left-click on torrent A -> select torrent A.
2. Left-click on torrent B -> select torrent B (in addition to A).
3. Currently: left-click on torrent C to select torrent C (in addition to A and B), then right-click any torrent (Note: even a non-selected torrent, which shouldn't happen IMHO) to open the right-click menu with torrents A, B and C as its actionable targets.
4. Proposed: right-click on torrent C to select torrent C (in addition to A and B) and immediately open the right-click menu with torrents A, B and C as its actionable targets. This also fixes the Note above, because right-clicking on a torrent will now properly add it to the selection

Plus all the Ctrl/Shift functionality outlined above.

**EDIT:** I realize this is slightly different than what I proposed initially, but after thinking about it, deselecting the previously selected torrents when right-clicking a new torrent isn't really intuitive.

In the same way that left-clicking a torrent will add it to the group of previously selected torrents (if any), right-clicking it should do the same and only additionally open the right-click menu.

issueDTO.title: improvement: Parallel process postgres wal logs changes
issueDTO.description:
Currently, WAL (Write-Ahead Logging) changes are processed synchronously. To optimize performance and reliability, this should be transitioned to asynchronous processing while ensuring all edge cases are thoroughly addressed.

https://github.com/datazip-inc/olake/blob/ed705d25bc0cd1f048f2fa3e6309b3f55fb71b45/pkg/waljs/filter.go#L40-L45

---

###### This issue was generated by [todo-issue](https://github.com/DerJuulsn/todo-issue) based on a `TODO` comment in ed705d25bc0cd1f048f2fa3e6309b3f55fb71b45. It's been assigned to @hash-data because they committed the code.
comments: @hash-data  Can you please assign me this issue? Is it still relevant?
hey @hash-data , is this issue still relevant? your review on above PR read "closing as too many changes in source file"
hey @zriyanshdz Please assign this to me ! as i saw it is in open state

Hey @hash-data,
I’ve implemented the parallel processing for WAL changes.
To ensure all scenarios are covered, I found that the tests in postgres_test.go
(since FilterChange is used via Socket in the Postgres driver).

However, these tests require a running PostgreS Resplica Setup on my local machine.
Is running a local Postgres replica the only way to fully test this, or is there a recommended way to run these tests ?

Thank you!
@hash-data or would running docker-compose.yml in postgres driver helps? to test full coverage

repository.description: Fastest open-source tool for replicating Databases to Data Lake in Open Table Formats like Apache Iceberg. ⚡ Efficient, quick and scalable data ingestion for real-time analytics.  Supporting Postgres, MongoDB and MySQL
repository.name: olake

summary.main: The current issue is that WAL changes are processed synchronously, which should be transitioned to asynchronous processing to optimize performance and reliability.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is for WAL changes to be processed asynchronously, optimizing performance and reliability, while ensuring all edge cases are thoroughly addressed.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix involves transitioning the WAL (Write-Ahead Logging) changes from synchronous to asynchronous processing, ensuring all edge cases are thoroughly addressed. Running a local Postgres replica or using docker-compose.yml in the postgres driver might be necessary to fully test the implementation.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'good first issue', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle.

issueDTO.title: Improve dropzone visual appeal
issueDTO.description:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently the dropzone consists of a dotted lines and some text in the middle.
It would be nice to improve that and make it look nicer

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/54b392b5-296d-477b-855f-c3d74af780dc)

**Describe the solution you'd like**
 - Rename (and deprecate) `ui.dropzone` -> `ui.drop_zone.enable`. `ui.dropzone_info` -> `ui.drop_zone.info`
 - Add a `ui.drop_zone.show_logo` libf3d option
 - Add F3D black and white logo in the middle of the dropzone when libf3d option is turned on
 - Add SDK testing of the libf3d options
 - Update all related baselines

repository.description: Fast and minimalist 3D viewer.
repository.name: f3d

summary.main: The current dropzone consists of dotted lines and text in the middle, and it would be nice to improve its appearance by adding a logo and other visual enhancements.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is to improve the visual appeal of the dropzone, making it look nicer and more appealing to users.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by renaming and deprecating certain UI components, adding a new libf3d option to show a logo in the dropzone, and updating related baselines. SDK testing of the libf3d options is also required.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'help wanted' and 'good first issue', indicating it's a suitable issue for a contributor to tackle.

issueDTO.title: Provide GitHub artifact attestations for GH release assets too
issueDTO.description:
I see since 16.0.4 there are artifact attestations available, https://github.com/topgrade-rs/topgrade/attestations

However, these are for PyPI wheels and tarball only.

It would be nice to have attestations for the GitHub release assets, too.
comments: Sounds good, feel free to submit a PR if you know how to implement this!
#1216 should do it

repository.description: Upgrade all the things
repository.name: topgrade

summary.main: The issue is about providing artifact attestations for GitHub release assets, which is currently missing in the topgrade-rs/topgrade repository. The existing attestations are only for PyPI wheels and tarball, and this issue aims to extend the feature to include GitHub release assets.
summary.validationOrRequirement: The expected behavior is to provide GitHub artifact attestations for GH release assets, ensuring that the release assets are verified and trustworthy.
summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by adding artifact attestations for GitHub release assets, building upon the existing attestations for PyPI wheels and tarball. The implementation details can be found in issue #1216, which should provide a starting point for the fix.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'C-feature request', 'needs PR', and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant feature request suitable for a contributor to tackle. A pull request should be submitted targeting the main branch with implementation details if possible.

comments: Hi @mikecheongx - thanks for this report. I'll try to repro in Cloud Shell and report back. I hadn't tried this surface before.

```bash
ls: cannot access '/home/mikecheong86/go/bin': No such file or directory
```
This line makes me think that `~/go/bin` doesn't exist.

In trying this on my cloud shell, `~/go` did exist, but the `bin` subdir didn't.

**It looks like you'll have to manually create the `~/go/bin` dir.**

I manually did the following

```bash
mkdir ~/go/bin
export PATH=$PATH:~/go/bin
/bin/bash install.sh
```

This installed the mcp servers at the expected location and this worked:

```bash
which mcp-imagen-go
/home/ghchinoy/gopath/bin/mcp-imagen-go
```

Please try this and if this works for you, I'll clarify the [README](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/vertex-ai-creative-studio/blob/main/experiments/mcp-genmedia/mcp-genmedia-go/README.md)

I validated via the following and received the expected tool list JSON.

```bash
export PROJECT_ID=$(gcloud config get project)
```

summary.attemptedFixes:
The fix is to manually create the `~/go/bin` directory and update the PATH environment variable. The user can do this by running the following commands:

```
mkdir ~/go/bin

/bin/bash install.sh
```

This should allow the `install.sh` script to install the MCP servers successfully.

The installation fails for the mcp-genmedia experiment due to a missing `~/go/bin` directory. To resolve this issue, manually create the directory and update the PATH environment variable. The `install.sh` script should then be able to install the MCP servers successfully.

Additionally, the user's Cloud Shell session does not have the correct PATH set up, which is why the command `which mcp-imagen-go` fails. To fix this, the user needs to manually set the PATH variable to include the `~/go/bin` directory.

The issue has been labeled as 'good first issue' and 'documentation', indicating that it is a suitable task for a contributor to tackle.

The user has been asked to try the solution and report back if it works.

issueDTO.title: Use Wails’ Single Instance Lock to ensure only one application instance runs at a time
issueDTO.description:
### Description

## Description

### Current State
There is currently no limit to how many instances of Zen can run simultaneously. This is impractical and causes several issues:
- Multiple instances may concurrently update application files, potentially leading to inconsistent state.
- On Windows, each instance creates its own tray icon, cluttering the system tray.
- On macOS, after a shutdown or reboot, the system restores previously active applications. If autostart is enabled in Zen's settings, this may result in multiple instances launching at startup, creating a poor user experience.

### Desired State
The application should use Wails’ [Single Instance Lock](https://wails.io/docs/guides/single-instance-lock/) to ensure only one instance is active at a time.

### Notes
- `OnSecondInstanceLaunch` should inspect the arguments passed to the new instance (`secondInstanceData.Args`). If `--start` is present, the existing instance should call `app.StartProxy`.
comments:
👋 Marking this as a `good first issue`!

If you're interested in tackling it, be sure to check out our [Getting Started guide](https://github.com/anfragment/zen/blob/master/docs/internal/index.md#getting-started) to get the project up and running. Feel free to ask any questions here if you need help!
@anfragment I'd like to give this a try. I might take a bit longer due to my job , but I’ll do my best to complete it.
@kasyap1234 Of course, go for it!

issueDTO.title: Remove dead code
issueDTO.description:
### Requirement

Remove dead code from the repository

### Proposal

Use official `deadcode` tool to identify unused code https://mfbmina.dev/en/posts/golang-deadcode/. It currently lists quite a few functions and packages.

### Recommended process

1. Run deadcode tool and pick ONE package to focus on.
2. Post a comment to this issue stating which package you're working on
3. Do not just delete the package / function, do some research first
   * find where (which PR) the function was introduced and what was using it & why
   * ideally find the PR in which that usage was removed without removing the function itself
   * post your findings in the comments to validate with maintainers that it's ok to delete
comments:
Hi @yurishkuro,

i have started with identification of unreachable functions with deadcode.
i am working on **cmd/ingester/** module and found out some deadcode but facing issues in pin pointing the related commit and PR.

Any help will be greatly appreciated.

Thanks!!

You can use git blame to show commits for specific lines, or git log to show history of the whole file. Sometimes files get moved so you may need to follow those moves. Once you have an interesting commit use git show to see more details and the pr number usually will be in the commit message.

Thanks,

Sure, I will leverage the information for further investigation.

Hi @yurishkuro 
I have been examining the `examples` package and found a function that is not in use https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/blob/cc7ea8d7fd5403c78e0a23db5c6bf06188c32546/examples/hotrod/pkg/pool/pool.go#L41

It was in introduced in pr [#40](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pull/40)
and was latest updated in pr [#1454](https://github.com/jaegertracing/jaeger/pull/1454)

I am not able to find or get a clear indication where in the current codebase it was being used.

@AnmolxSingh this is because HotROD does not implement proper shutdown sequence, which should be invoked when the program receives a kill signal (other Jaeger binaries do trap the signal and perform shutdown)

issueDTO.title: Rest API. Постраничная выдача и сортировка
issueDTO.description:
На текущий момент есть контроллеры для thymeleaf шаблонов с поддержкой `Pagable` и фильтрации через `JpaSpecificationExecutor`. Эта функциональность удобна и нужна для перехода на новый Web интерфейс, который будет взаимодействовать с Investbook посредством Rest API ([spacious-team/investbook-pages](https://github.com/spacious-team/investbook-pages)). Поэтому в Rest API нужно добавить функциональности:
- [x] Pageable ([ spring-boot-starter-data-jpa](https://www.baeldung.com/spring-data-web-support))
- [ ] Querydsl Web (см. раздел 7 по той же ссылке)
- [ ] Заменить существующий код JPA Specification на Query DSL ([сравнение 1](https://spring.io/blog/2011/04/26/advanced-spring-data-jpa-specifications-and-querydsl), [сравнение 2](https://www.baeldung.com/jpa-criteria-querydsl-differences))
comments: Hey Vananiev. Can I work on this issue.? Is some is working on this issue.
@imnk97 , cool :+1:  Nobody is working on it yet. You could implement it. I will wait PR to develop from you.

Please, add appropriate method(s) to [AbstractRestController](https://github.com/spacious-team/investbook/blob/develop/src/main/java/ru/investbook/api/AbstractRestController.java) and it implementions to extend existing Rest API.
Relates gh-498
As I see, the above issue is still open, Is this project ongoing? Let me know further (DOCS) to contribute to it as a "good first issue"?
@vimalJD, Sorry missed your message. Project is still ongoing. It would be cool if you contributed
Осталось сделать Querydsl Web
Привет, @vananiev! Я могу заняться данным issue и доделать часть с Querydsl Web
Привет, @Sheventon! Это отлично, задачей сейчас никто не занимается! Готов принять от вас PR.
Привет, @vananiev! Актуальна ли эта issue? Если нет, я хотел узнать, нет ли каких-то задач на Rest API?
@powerpuff-luv, заявка актуальна. По текущей заявке нужно доделать Querydsl Web.

После релаизации #639 в classpath будет 2 технологии: JPA Criteria и Query DSL ([сравнение 1](https://spring.io/blog/2011/04/26/advanced-spring-data-jpa-specifications-and-querydsl), [сравнение 2](https://www.baeldung.com/jpa-criteria-querydsl-differences)), которые могут выполнять одно и то же, а именно запрашивать данные. Например
```java
public interface PortfolioPropertyRepository extends
        JpaRepository<PortfolioPropertyEntity, Integer>,
        JpaSpecificationExecutor<PortfolioPropertyEntity>,
        QuerydslPredicateExecutor<PortfolioPropertyEntity> {
```

Требуется переписать код на Query DSL и удалить зависимость от  JPA Criteria, т.к. последний менее читаемый.

Query DSL добавляет около 5 МБ зависимостей. В то же время JPA Specification является частью Spring JPA.

issueDTO.title: Add shortcut for clear conversation in webui
issueDTO.description:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c8935aa7-f3a6-4c15-82a1-fb01882395a7)

---

## Problem

Saiki WebUI already offers a **“Reset conversation”** action in the overflow menu, but there is **no keyboard shortcut**. Users must open the menu each time, which disrupts workflow.

## Proposed Solution

Add a keyboard shortcut **Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + R** to trigger the existing reset flow.

## Current State

| ✅ Already Exists | Location |
|------------------|----------|
| Reset-conversation API endpoint | `/api/sessions/${sessionId}/reset` |
| `handleResetConversation` function | `src/app/webui/components/ChatApp.tsx` (around line 157) |
| Reset confirmation dialog UI | Same file |
| Keyboard-shortcut infrastructure | `ChatApp.tsx` (lines 240-281) |
| Other shortcuts (e.g., Ctrl+J, Ctrl+K, Ctrl+L) | `ChatApp.tsx` |

## Implementation Steps

1. **Add Keyboard Shortcut Handler**  
   File: `src/app/webui/components/ChatApp.tsx`  
   Inside the existing `useEffect` that listens for keydown events (≈ line 240):

   ```tsx
   // Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + R  →  Reset conversation
   if ((e.ctrlKey || e.metaKey) && e.shiftKey && e.key === 'R') {
     e.preventDefault();
     if (currentSessionId && !isWelcomeState) {
       setResetDialogOpen(true);
     }
   }
   ```

2. **Update Shortcuts Modal**  
   Still in `ChatApp.tsx` (≈ line 652), extend the shortcuts array:

   ```tsx
   { key: '⌘⇧R', desc: 'Reset conversation' }, // new shortcut
   ```

3. **(Optional) Update Welcome Screen Hint**  
   In the quick-tips section (≈ line 437), mention the new shortcut.

## Testing Steps

refer src/app/webui/README.md for steps to set up the webUI locally for testing

（テスト用のユーザー・パスワード等があるのでしょうか？もしくはsupabaseのauthサービスにクエリ直でデータ投入って感じですかね？）

@kakuni0119 
ありがとうございます！

ローカルでユーザー新規登録をして、
https://github.com/team-mirai-volunteer/action-board?tab=readme-ov-file#%E3%82%B5%E3%83%BC%E3%83%93%E3%82%B9%E3%81%AE%E8%B5%B7%E5%8B%95%E6%96%B9%E6%B3%95 に記載のInbucketにメールが来るので、それで登録完了できます！

@muraikenta 
ありがとうございます！できました！

@muraikenta 
**GAで定義するコンバージョン（キャッチアップすべきサービス上のユーザーの挙動）を考えてみました。以下です。**
前提として、GAの目的を、アクションボードへの導線・誘導の課題抽出。アクションボード自体の課題抽出。としています。

1. そもそもサービスへのアクセス絶対数が少ない
2. サービスへ到達したが、直帰してしまった。
3. サービスへアクセスしたがサインアップしていない
4. サインアップしたが、1つもミッションを報告していない
5. 達成報告フォームページまで行ったが、報告をしていない

一旦ここまでをneed to haveとし、必要なメトリクスを収集していくのはどうでしょう？
あと、これらの挙動に紐づくユーザーの属性ですが、ユーザーID(キー)、性別、年齢をカスタムで追加しようと思います。
（デフォルトではCookieでユーザー判別してるので、ユーザーIDが必要です）

**尚、デフォルト設定ですでに収集可能となっている項目は以下です。**
（これらをユーザー別、画面別※で見れる感じです）

- 遷移元リンク
- 初回来訪数
- 新規/リピート数
- ユーザー数
- ページ別の表示回数
- ページビュー数
- スクロール数
- 市町村
- デバイス
- プラットフォーム
- ユーザー平均エンゲージメント時間
- 外部リンク押下数
- フォーム入力数
- セッション継続時間

※画面はSPAだとすべて同一画面に集約して表示されてしまう（あたかもページ遷移していないような収集結果）ので、ここも合わせて対応します。

issueDTO.title: FR: command-line argument to set the auto-refresh period
issueDTO.description:
I tried using `jjui` in the `nixpkgs` repo, and it didn't work well because the 4-second auto-refresh interval I configured is too short for such a large repo.

It'd be nice if I could run something like `jjui -n 10` to set a 10-second interval or `jjui -n 0` to disable auto-refresh, overriding whatever default value I set in my config.

Another option I wondered about would be to allow per-repo configs for jjui (e.g. by reusing jj's per-repo config), but that's a larger change and I think a CLI option would be nice regardless.

The `-n` name would conflict with #113. I picked it because the `watch` command calls it `-n` or `--interval`, and I'm used to it. I don't care much what it's called. Random alternatives that come to mind: perhaps `--interval` is good. `-s` (for "seconds") might work. `-i` seems a bit sketchy; it works, but would be more intuitive for something like "interactive".
comments:
Hey, thanks for the suggestion.

My plan was to avoid all these issues with the experimental batching, but I can see that even `jj log` takes longer than 4 seconds to list the first set of revisions. With that observation, I think it makes sense to add command line arguments to set the limit and auto refresh interval. I will have a look at this.

I would like to stick to the defaults of `jj`, so `-n` should set the `--limit` and we can think of something for auto refresh interval.
This can be implemented in a similar fashion how `-r` was implemented.

summary.attemptedFixes: The fix can be implemented by adding command line arguments to set the limit and auto refresh interval, similar to how the `-r` option was implemented.
summary.otherNotes: This issue is currently labeled as 'enhancement' and 'good first issue', indicating it's a significant issue suitable for a contributor to tackle.

issueDTO.title: [FR]: New Evaluaton Metric "LLM Sycophancy" (SycEval)
issueDTO.description:
### Proposal summary

We like to extend the existing LLM-as-a-judge evaluation metrics to include a new judge metric called "Sycophancy". Full paper with the methodology and prompts can be found here: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2502.08177

Example of an existing judge metric (Hallucination) is defined here:
- Docs: https://www.comet.com/docs/opik/evaluation/metrics/hallucination
- Docs Code: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/apps/opik-documentation/documentation/fern/docs/evaluation/metrics/hallucination.mdx
- Python SDK: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/tree/main/sdks/python/src/opik/evaluation/metrics/llm_judges/hallucination
- Python Examples: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/sdks/python/examples/metrics.py
- Frontend: https://github.com/comet-ml/opik/blob/main/apps/opik-frontend/src/constants/llm.ts

Expectation is the new judge is added to the frontend for using LLM-as-a-judge from the UI (Online Evaluation tab) as well as in the Python SDK. The appropriate docs needs to be updated and a video attached of the metric working.

### Motivation

I would like to see more robust set of metrics and evaluations based on recent research
comments:
_Please note this bounty is embargo'd for attendees to the Encode x Comet Vibe Coding Challenges in London from Friday 20th June till Sunday 22nd June (GMT). Any attempts from users not in the event will be ignored. Post 22nd June if unclaimed/no attempts then we will accept other entries._

/bounty 25

## 💎 $25 bounty [• Comet](https://algora.io/comet-ml)
#### Steps to solve:
1. **Read Contributing Docs**: See [contributing guide](https://www.comet.com/docs/opik/contributing/overview) and read on how to setup Opik and contribute to various parts of the code base.
1. **Start working**: Comment `/attempt #2520` with your implementation plan
2. **Submit work**: Create a pull request including `/claim #2520` in the PR body to claim the bounty
4. **Review**: Team will review PR and any clarifying questions and if successful changes will be merged
3. **Receive payment**: 100% of the bounty is received 2-5 days post-reward. [Make sure you are eligible for payouts](https://algora.io/docs/payments#supported-countries-regions)

#### ❗ Important guidelines:
- Do NOT start multiple bounties
- To claim a bounty, you need to **provide a short demo video** of your changes in your pull request
- If anything is unclear, **ask for clarification** before starting as this will help avoid potential rework
- Low quality AI PRs will not receive review and will be closed
- Please ask to be assigned before attempting to work on the bounty

Thank you for contributing to Comet!

| Attempt | Started (UTC) | Solution | Actions |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 🟢 @mukulpythondev | Jun 22, 2025, 03:18:56 AM | WIP |  |
| 🟢 @yashkumar2603 | Jun 29, 2025, 08:04:23 AM | #2624 | [Reward](https://algora.io/claims/3whEj7Twi7LygaPt) |
/attempt #2520

/attempt #2520

My implementation plan is :
- Create a similar folder structure as hallucination metric in `sdks/python/src/opik/evaluation/metrics/llm_judges/` named `/syc_eval`.
- Follow similar code structuring as hallucination metric and create files in which the rebuttal mechanism will be written.
- The key innovation in the paper is to categorize the sycophancy into Progressive and Regressive sycophancy.
- Four rebuttal strength levels will be configured : simple, ethos, justification, citation.
- the evaluation will be a 2-step process with initial response evaluation and then rebuttal response evaluation.
- then we calculate overall sycophancy rates, progressive rates, and regressive rates. Creating detailed breakdown by rebuttal type and context mode.

Then the FE integration will be proceeded with :
- configure the UI components for configuring SycEval parameters on FE. Including toggles/selection for different rebuttal types and strengths
- Add context mode selection (radio buttons or dropdown)

Let me know thoughts and inputs on this, I am starting to work on it, I already did setup the codebase locally. Hoping to make meaningful contributions ✌ .

issueDTO.title: Refactoring for Unit Test Access Controls
issueDTO.description:
Part of #12048

## Issue
After most of the Unit Test migration in #12048, there are a lot of inconsistencies in access control test methods. This is because we did not migrate the many convenient, abstracted, and commonly used access control test methods from `ui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java` to `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`.

After merging #13254, all of the access control test methods in `BaseActionTest.java` have been migrated. Hence, this issue aims to refactor the unit test access controls to use these convenient test methods.

## Progress
The progress for this refactoring can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IcB-viJMrIOknYoBYasBuRBK9qnwY0-doEK4_Eb24IA/edit?gid=0#gid=0).

## Steps to Contribute

1. Choose test(s) to work on in the above Google Sheets link, and comment on this issue to indicate that you'd like to contribute on the chosen test(s).
2. Create a PR to refactor the unit test(s).
3. Submit the PR, with a link to this issue by starting the description with "Part of #13304"

## Tips

- Understand the access control test methods in `sqlui/webapi/BaseActionTest.java`, follow the refactoring in #13254
- Most of the access control testing logic in the migrated unit tests under `sqlui/webapi` follows the old unit tests under `ui/webapi`, so you may wish to reference the old unit test for help
comments:
**Good First Issue - Notes for Contributors**
  This issue is for **first-time contributors only**. If you are new to TEAMMATES, feel free to submit a PR for this issue.

*Please note that we allow only one `good first issue` per contributor.* If you have already made a prior contribution to TEAMMATES, you may wish to take a look at issues with the `help wanted` tag instead.

**We do not assign issues to contributors**. If you would like to pick up this issue, do post a comment below to express your interest and check if there is anyone else who is already working on the issue. We will do our best to reply and give you the go-ahead, but if we don't, feel free to submit a PR as long as there is no one else working on it.

**To get started**, do read through our [contributing guidelines](https://teammates.github.io/teammates/contributing-doc.html) carefully, and [set up a development environment on your local machine](https://teammates.github.io/teammates/setting-up.html) before making a PR.

If you need any clarifications on our [developer guide](https://teammates.github.io/teammates/index.html), or are facing issues that are not found in our [troubleshooting guide](https://teammates.github.io/teammates/troubleshooting-guide.html), please [post a message in our discussion forum](https://github.com/TEAMMATES/teammates/discussions).

# Description

The library currently lacks support for the `track` element. HTML5 reference: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/media.html#the-track-element. 
Note that this element has no end tag, that means it may not have children.

# What to do

- [ ] Add new element function in `elements.go`
- [ ] Add the test case in `elements_test.go` 
- [ ] Check attributes which the `track` element has, add them to `attrs` package if not already present.

issueDTO.title: `pixi global uninstall <non-existent-env>` creates an empty directory
issueDTO.description:
### Checks

- [x] I have checked that this issue has not already been reported.

- [x] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [latest version](https://github.com/prefix-dev/pixi/releases) of pixi, using `pixi --version`.


### Reproducible example

```shell
$ pixi --version
pixi 0.48.2
$ pixi global uninstall example
Error:   × Couldn't remove example
  ╰─▶ Environment example doesn't exist.
$ ls ~/.pixi/envs
example/
```


### Issue description

When `pixi global uninstall` is given the name of an environment that doesn't exist, it leaves an empty directory with the given name in `~/.pixi/envs`.

### Expected behavior

`pixi global uninstall` shouldn't leave an empty directory if it attempts to remove an environment that doesn't exist.
comments: Nice find! I can reproduce this on my machine.

issueDTO.title: [EPIC] Implement expressions as ScalarUDFImpl
comments:
Wondering if it makes sense to convert some of these. Specifically the two I added:
- `GetStructField`: DataFusion has a similar `get_field` already we could use, but it operates by field name instead of index, so it has to find the right field by name for each batch which adds some overhead, which is some of the downside it seems to the UDFs over logical and physical expressions which can optimize these cases at analysis time. Implementing a custom ScalarUDF also doesn't really make sense because as a user you would never select a nested field by index, always by name.
- `GetArrayStructFields`: There's no equivalent DataFusion expression AFAIK, but the same thing above applies where there's not really a use cases for using this function directly, Spark just creates this at analysis time from an `ExtractValue` operation

issueDTO.title: bug(python): Graceful Handling of Empty Result Sets After Hard Filtering
issueDTO.description:
### LanceDB version

_No response_

### What happened?

Description:
When applying hard filters via LanceDB and the result set is empty, a list index out of range exception is raised during subsequent rerank operations. This occurs because the downstream logic assumes at least one result is always returned after search/filter, which isn’t guaranteed.

```bash

../.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/lancedb/query.py:334: in to_list
    return self.to_arrow().to_pylist()
../.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/lancedb/query.py:1199: in to_arrow
    return self._combine_hybrid_results(
../.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/lancedb/query.py:1248: in _combine_hybrid_results
    results = reranker.rerank_hybrid(fts_query, vector_results, fts_results)
../.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/lancedb/rerankers/answerdotai.py:68: in rerank_hybrid
    combined_results = self._rerank(combined_results, query)
../.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/lancedb/rerankers/answerdotai.py:50: in _rerank
    result = self.reranker.rank(query, docs, doc_ids=doc_ids)
../.venv/lib/python3.11/site-packages/rerankers/models/colbert_ranker.py:264: in rank
    docs = prep_docs(docs, doc_ids, metadata)
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 

docs = [], doc_ids = [], metadata = None

    def prep_docs(
        docs: Union[str, List[str], Document, List[Document]],
        doc_ids: Optional[Union[List[str], List[int]]] = None,
        metadata: Optional[List[dict]] = None,
    ):
        if isinstance(docs, Document) or (
>           isinstance(docs, List) and isinstance(docs[0], Document)
        ):
E       IndexError: list index out of range

```

### Are there known steps to reproduce?

_No response_

issueDTO.title: Using the "Download as Image" option in a table chart or handlebar chart nested in a dashboard only downloads the visible section of the chart and not the full table
issueDTO.description:
### Bug description

When you have a table chart or a handlebar chart (This one simulating the table UI) inside a dashboard, if you use the Download as Image option of that chart, the downloaded image only considers the visual section shown in the dashboard and not the full chart.

1. Create a regular table chart.
2. Add to a dashboard, so that it doesn’t show up entirely (it shows the scroll bar).
3. Download the table chart from the dashboard as an image.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d57b0a93-b425-4663-a5a7-059445d1398e)

## Expected results
The downloaded image considers all the information that the table chart has

## Actual results
The downloaded image only considers the information shown in the dashboard and not the full table 

### Screenshots/recordings

_No response_

### Superset version

master / latest-dev

### Python version

3.11

### Node version

18 or greater

### Browser

Chrome

### Additional context

_No response_

### Checklist

- [x] I have searched Superset docs and Slack and didn't find a solution to my problem.
- [x] I have searched the GitHub issue tracker and didn't find a similar bug report.
- [x] I have checked Superset's logs for errors and if I found a relevant Python stacktrace, I included it here as text in the "additional context" section.
comments:
<!-- Answer -->
This is a known limitation: when you use "Download as Image" on a table or handlebar chart in a dashboard, only the visible portion is exported. This happens because Superset uses the `dom-to-image-more` library, which captures only what's currently rendered in the DOM—so if the chart/table is scrollable, only the visible section is included in the image export. There is no code in the current implementation to expand the table or render all rows before capturing the image, and no workarounds or enhancements for this have been documented or proposed in recent issues or pull requests [[source]](https://github.com/apache/superset/blob/e0e3f9494972e90b3eec7a23d75747e0e63c07c9/superset-frontend/src/utils/downloadAsImage.ts).

This limitation is specific to table and handlebar charts. Other chart types (like bar, line, or pie charts) that use ECharts can export the full chart regardless of what is visible, because ECharts provides its own export API that isn't limited by the DOM viewport.

Currently, the only alternatives are to export the data as CSV or use a browser extension to capture the full scrollable area, but these are not integrated solutions. If you need the full table as an image, you would need a feature enhancement that temporarily expands the table before capture or stitches together multiple images.

@msyavuz I would love to work on this.

@dosu I have tried to solve this but it seems that the only way is to make the scrollable content visible on the dom and then only will we be able to capture them can you suggest something and also can i use echart api instead of the dom-to-image-more.

<!-- Answer -->
You can't use the ECharts API for table or handlebar charts in Superset because these charts are rendered as HTML tables (via React) and not as ECharts visualizations. The ECharts export API only works for ECharts-based charts like bar, line, or pie charts.

For table/handlebar charts, Superset uses dom-to-image-more, which captures only what's currently rendered in the DOM. Since the DataTable component paginates and virtualizes rows, only the visible portion is exported as an image—there's no built-in logic to expand or render all rows before export. To capture the full table, you'd need to programmatically disable pagination and virtualization (e.g., set page size to all rows), wait for the DOM to update, trigger the image export, and then restore the original state. This approach can cause major performance issues for large tables and isn't currently implemented in Superset. See the relevant code for DataTable and downloadAsImage for more details:  
[downloadAsImage.ts](https://github.com/apache/superset/blob/2e9939baf253e607a54722b1996baaf625e72133/superset-frontend/src/utils/downloadAsImage.ts)  
[DataTable.tsx](https://github.com/apache/superset/blob/2e9939baf253e607a54722b1996baaf625e72133/superset-frontend/plugins/plugin-chart-table/src/DataTable/DataTable.tsx)

Any solution will need to balance user experience and performance, especially for large datasets. There are no alternative export methods or workarounds documented in the repo.

issueDTO.title: 📜  Rename "commands" to "keywords" consistently where applicable
issueDTO.description:
We use the words "commands" and "keywords" mixed in the code base and in the UI. 

Just so we are clear: What I mean with both is: print, ask, if, where, etc. What you'd call keywords in any programming language.

I suspect the original logical was that for us developers keywords is clear, but for kids, it is not, so commands (commando's in Dutch) is clearer, but commands also shows up in the code base (see: https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Ahedyorg%2Fhedy%20commands&type=code) 

So one cleanup it to rename commands to keywords in the codebase. Another question if whether "commands" is even the right word for kid-facing texts? Command is more "print hello"; a thing you say to the computer to command it, than a keyword like print alone.

But maybe we can leave that for now and at least clean up the code base a bit more.

issueDTO.title: [DOC]: Illegal use of dynamic Tailwind utility classes in docs
issueDTO.description:
## Description

The docs use Tailwind [utility classes](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/styling-with-utility-classes) for styling a lot ("h-5" (height), "pr-1" (padding-right), etc.), which is really convenient and nice. The problem is, because Tailwind produces optimized production code by only bundling the classes that are consumed in the components, which it determines based on static analysis, writing class-names that are composed from run-time variables, like React component props, is prone to failure. For instance, `bg-${props.item.color}` may not work, because Tailwind will not know what `bg-<color>` classes it needs to ship with the code, and so it turns out the class `.bg-pink` has no styles declared. Sometimes you can get away with it, because somewhere *else* in the codebase, `bg-pink` is used explicitly, and therefore gets bundled with the code, and so if your component gets `.bg-pink` at runtime, it will luckily find the classname and get the correct style.

For the most part, this is probably a pretty insignificant anti-pattern, but the reason I'm bringing it up is because of the Table of Contents in the Docs - I noticed that they don't do recursive indentation of sub-classes/methods/etc. For instance:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/985aee08-ac42-4ba3-886b-d4e944c3214b)

The headers on the page are H1, H2, H2, and then H3, H3, H3. But as you can see, the H3's (Pull Requests, CIPs, and Discord) are de-indented, whereas a natural assumption would be that each sub-header gets indented more. Indeed, that appears to be the intention of the code, because the classes for the corresponding names in the ToC include `.pl-1`, (padding-left-1), `.pl-2`, and `.pl-3`.

The problem is these padding utility classes are defined with template strings based off props, where each item is dynamically assigned a "level" property through some code, and then the class is something like `pl-${level}`. Because, coincidentally, `.pl-1` and `.pl-2` are used elsewhere in the codebase in a static fashion, their styles are included in the production bundle - but `.pl-3` isn't. So it does nothing. This is why the `###` H3's have no padding/indentation.

For reference: 
* https://tailwindcss.com/docs/detecting-classes-in-source-files#dynamic-class-names
* https://github.com/chroma-core/chroma/blob/6586c1c28920210731c51801178482aa6c72a7d8/docs/docs.trychroma.com/components/table-of-contents.tsx#L22

> toc.map((item) => (
            <div key={item.id} className={`mt-1 **pl-${item.level * 1}**`}>

## Solution

There's probably some clever solutions to achieve dynamic utility classes, and there are a few other places in the code where this anti-pattern appears, but a really simple way to fix this is just to add `.pl-1/2/3/4/5` to the `globals.css` in order to fix the ToC and call it a day. The only question is whether the maintainers actually would like to see progressive indentation for the Table of Contents. If so, I'd be happy to put together a PR that fixes this issue, so that, e.g. the last three items on the ToC in the screenshot above are actually indented further, and the hierarchical structure of the page is reflected in the ToC. Since the upper bound on heading levels is pretty small, we can just ship them all and it's almost no cost.

Although it's clearly been written in such a way that it's _supposed_ to have recursive indentation, I'd just like an OK from a maintainer that this would be a minor cosmetic improvement, and I'll go ahead and submit a fix.

Either way, we should stop writing dynamic utility classes, because it's not supported by Tailwind.
comments: @hesreallyhim do you want to give that a shot? really great write-up!

> @hesreallyhim do you want to give that a shot? really great write-up! 

Yeah no problem, it should be a quick patch if we just want to handle the table of contents issue I noted. I'll just add "pl-{1..5}" to the global styles

Hi @nikd10 , I opened a PR to fix it, but it didn't get merged, you should check out the thread here for more info: https://github.com/chroma-core/chroma/pull/4307 and maybe follow up with the other participant if you want more info, I'm not sure what the status is. issueDTO.title: Add support for Output preview of Parquet files
issueDTO.description:
### Feature description

Parquet is such an important file format in data lakehouse architectures that we should support Output preview of parquet files:

![image](https://github.com/kestra-io/kestra/assets/86264395/1e86d08c-85ab-4072-b7c3-0c3a51c96c34)

Example flow: https://kestra.io/blueprints/ingest/company.team.zip_to_parquet

```yaml
id: zip_to_parquet
namespace: company.team
variables:
  file_id: "{{ execution.startDate | dateAdd(-3, 'MONTHS') | date('yyyyMM') }}"
tasks:
  - id: get_zipfile
    type: io.kestra.plugin.core.http.Download
    uri: https://divvy-tripdata.s3.amazonaws.com/{{ render(vars.file_id)
      }}-divvy-tripdata.zip
  - id: unzip
    type: io.kestra.plugin.compress.ArchiveDecompress
    algorithm: ZIP
    from: "{{ outputs.get_zipfile.uri }}"
  - id: parquet_output
    type: io.kestra.plugin.scripts.python.Script
    warningOnStdErr: false
    taskRunner:
      type: io.kestra.plugin.scripts.runner.docker.Docker
    containerImage: ghcr.io/kestra-io/pydata:latest
    env:
      FILE_ID: "{{ render(vars.file_id) }}"
    inputFiles: "{{ outputs.unzip.files }}"
    script: |
      import os
      import pandas as pd

      file_id = os.environ["FILE_ID"]
      file = f"{file_id}-divvy-tripdata.csv"

      df = pd.read_csv(file)
      df.to_parquet(f"{file_id}.parquet")
    outputFiles:
      - "*.parquet"
```

issueDTO.title: AttributeError when trying to set hotkey
issueDTO.description:
## Classification:
Bug

## Reproducibility:
Allways

## AutoKey version:
0.95.10-4

## Used GUI:
gtk

## Installed via:
yay

## Linux distribution:
5.15.7-1-MANJARO #1 SMP PREEMPT Wed Dec 8 10:09:19 UTC 2021 x86_64 GNU/Linux

## Summary:

Hi! Getting AttributeError when trying to set hotkey


## Steps to reproduce:
-Set HotKey

## Expected result:
Hotkey sets 

## Actual result:
Nothing but AttributeError


## Verbose output (if applicable):
```
2022-01-02 14:35:02,912 ERROR - interface - Error in X event loop thread
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/autokey/interface.py", line 242, in __eventLoop
    method(*args)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/autokey/interface.py", line 674, in __grab_keyboard
    focus.grab_keyboard(True, X.GrabModeAsync, X.GrabModeAsync, X.CurrentTime)
AttributeError: 'int' object has no attribute 'grab_keyboard'
```
comments:
Interesting. A couple of questions:
- Does it happen with one specific hotkey or any hotkey you try to set?
- Does it happen on all of your scripts or just one?

A few more questions:
- Did this work for you before or is this a new install?
- If it worked before, what has changed/been updated since then.

Note: I didn't immediately find the focus module in our source code. Is it possible that its calling sequence has changed in a new version of an external package? Manjaro (Arch) gets bleeding edge updates.

- While we are investigating this..., is it possible to use the Qt version instead?

   On Arch, the two versions of AutoKey (GTK and Qt) are packaged separately, so this may require some extra effort to test. If you have any scripts and phrases already defined, be sure to make a backup of $HOME/.config/autokey (including hidden files) before doing any package management.

I had this happening to me with `/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/autokey/gtkui/dialogs.py`

This is what I did to fix it 
Replace `text = model.get_value(i.next().iter, 0)` with `text = model.get_value(next(i).iter, 0)` 

`i.next()` is Python 2 syntax.
Excellent find! It's added to the list of things to do once we can edit the code again.
@Elliria Is that a personal list or is in here somewhere like in a discussion thread?
It's a list in my personal wiki that has fifty-some-odd things in it so far that are either partially done or need to be done.
Might be nice to put some of that where others can find it if you're not around.

I did, once upon a time. A long while back, I created a GitHub repository for tracking tasks and populated it with an issue for each of my tasks.

That was problematic because when I linked to [AutoKey issues](https://github.com/autokey/autokey/issues) or [AutoKey discussions](https://github.com/autokey/autokey/discussions) in my tasks (which was necessary for completing them), GitHub recognized that I had done that and automatically included a back-link to my issues in the comments of their related AutoKey issues or AutoKey discussions.

This caused confusion in the AutoKey repository, so I was asked to find a different way to track my tasks. As a result, I moved them into my personal wiki, which is where they've lived ever since.

I haven't invented any tasks that don't already exist somewhere as AutoKey issues, as AutoKey discussions, as suggestions posted by users in comments under either of those, or as sample code posted by users in comments under either of those. This is just my personal collection derived from all of those sources.

issueDTO.title: AMDGPU: can optimize away v_readfirstlane_b32 on implicit_def input
issueDTO.description:
For the small testcase:
```
; RUN: llc -march=amdgcn -mcpu=gfx900 < %s

; Only one readfistlane is really needed

define amdgpu_ps void @test(i32 %in, ptr %out) {
  %v1 = insertelement <2 x i32> <i32 poison, i32 poison>, i32 %in, i32 0
  %v2 = bitcast <2 x i32> %v1 to i64
  %v3 = call i64 @llvm.amdgcn.s.quadmask.i64(i64 %v2)
  %p = inttoptr i64 %v2 to ptr addrspace(4)
  store i64 %v3, ptr %out
  ret void
}
```

We are producing code which has 2 v_readfirstlane_b32 instructions. Only one is needed as second one reads undef:

```
        v_readfirstlane_b32 s0, v0
        v_readfirstlane_b32 s1, v1
        s_quadmask_b64 s[0:1], s[0:1]
        v_mov_b32_e32 v4, s1
        v_mov_b32_e32 v3, s0
        flat_store_dwordx2 v[1:2], v[3:4]
        s_endpgm
```
Although backend does not see it is undef behind the REG_SEQUENCE.
comments:
@llvm/issue-subscribers-backend-amdgpu

Author: Stanislav Mekhanoshin (rampitec)

<details>
For the small testcase:
```
; RUN: llc -march=amdgcn -mcpu=gfx900 < %s

; Only one readfistlane is really needed

define amdgpu_ps void @<!-- -->test(i32 %in, ptr %out) {
  %v1 = insertelement <2 x i32> <i32 poison, i32 poison>, i32 %in, i32 0
  %v2 = bitcast <2 x i32> %v1 to i64
  %v3 = call i64 @<!-- -->llvm.amdgcn.s.quadmask.i64(i64 %v2)
  %p = inttoptr i64 %v2 to ptr addrspace(4)
  store i64 %v3, ptr %out
  ret void
}
```

We are producing code which has 2 v_readfirstlane_b32 instructions. Only one is needed as second one reads undef:

```
        v_readfirstlane_b32 s0, v0
        v_readfirstlane_b32 s1, v1
        s_quadmask_b64 s[0:1], s[0:1]
        v_mov_b32_e32 v4, s1
        v_mov_b32_e32 v3, s0
        flat_store_dwordx2 v[1:2], v[3:4]
        s_endpgm
```
Although backend does not see it is undef behind the REG_SEQUENCE.
</details>

Hi!

This issue may be a good introductory issue for people new to working on LLVM. If you would like to work on this issue, your first steps are:

1. Check that no other contributor has already been assigned to this issue. If you believe that no one is actually working on it despite an assignment, ping the person. After one week without a response, the assignee may be changed.
1. In the comments of this issue, request for it to be assigned to you, or just create a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) after following the steps below. [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.
1. Fix the issue locally.
1. [Run the test suite](https://llvm.org/docs/TestingGuide.html#unit-and-regression-tests) locally. Remember that the subdirectories under `test/` create fine-grained testing targets, so you can e.g. use `make check-clang-ast` to only run Clang's AST tests.
1. Create a Git commit.
1. Run [`git clang-format HEAD~1`](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html#git-integration) to format your changes.
1. Open a [pull request](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pulls) to the [upstream repository](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project) on GitHub. Detailed instructions can be found [in GitHub's documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/creating-a-pull-request). [Mention](https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue) this issue in the description of the pull request.

If you have any further questions about this issue, don't hesitate to ask via a comment in the thread below.

@llvm/issue-subscribers-good-first-issue

Author: Stanislav Mekhanoshin (rampitec)

<details>
For the small testcase:
```
; RUN: llc -march=amdgcn -mcpu=gfx900 < %s

; Only one readfistlane is really needed

define amdgpu_ps void @<!-- -->test(i32 %in, ptr %out) {
  %v1 = insertelement <2 x i32> <i32 poison, i32 poison>, i32 %in, i32 0
  %v2 = bitcast <2 x i32> %v1 to i64
  %v3 = call i64 @<!-- -->llvm.amdgcn.s.quadmask.i64(i64 %v2)
  %p = inttoptr i64 %v2 to ptr addrspace(4)
  store i64 %v3, ptr %out
  ret void
}
```

We are producing code which has 2 v_readfirstlane_b32 instructions. Only one is needed as second one reads undef:

```
        v_readfirstlane_b32 s0, v0
        v_readfirstlane_b32 s1, v1
        s_quadmask_b64 s[0:1], s[0:1]
        v_mov_b32_e32 v4, s1
        v_mov_b32_e32 v3, s0
        flat_store_dwordx2 v[1:2], v[3:4]
        s_endpgm
```
Although backend does not see it is undef behind the REG_SEQUENCE.
</details>
@kerbowa are you working on this, if not can I give it a go?
Most recently @JoshHuttonCode was looking at this issue.
Yes, I am taking a look at this issue.
@JoshHuttonCode are you still working on it?

Yes, I am. Now that my school term is done, I've got more time to work on it. Since this is my first issue, it's been taking me some time.

I have located the source of the issue, and I believe I have mostly implemented the fix. I am in the process of ensuring my fix does not break other use cases or have other side effects.
